Reviews.Title: “Great location to Magnificent Mile!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in downtown Chicago for one night in mid March. My friend and I had found this hotel to offer one of the lowest prices for a room in the Magnificent Mile shopping area. Overall, this was a nice hotel with friendly staff, and was in close proximity to many Chicago must-sees, including the famous 'bean' and Michigan Avenue shopping and restaurants. Pros -Check-in and Check-out were quick and efffortless. My friend and I asked to be put on a higher floor with a nice view, and he was able to meet both requests without a problem. -The room was large, clean, and had an excellent view of the Michigan Avenue bridge, the 'green' river (as it was right after St. Patrick's day), and iconic buildings and shops. The room had a modern feel and offered complimentary wifi. -The concierge staff were both friendly and helpful. We were given excellent dinner recommendations and easy-to-follow directions to our restaurant of choosing. The concierge in the morning was also able to point us in the right direction for the breakfast bagels we were craving! -We enjoyed a few drinks in the Angels and Kings bar located in the hotel, and it had a nice atmosphere. -The location is a few blocks from Michigan Avenue shopping in one direction, and about three blocks away from Millenium park and 'the bean' in the other direction. Cons -The only real con was lack of self-parking available at the hotel. The only option offered was to pay $50.00 for valet parking, or find your own self-parking a few blocks away. My friend and I, in an effort to save some money, decided to scope out self-parking (which we found one block away) and haul our luggage back to the hotel. While this was somewhat annoying, the self-parking was only $38.00 for 24 hours, so we saved some money. Overall, I would stay here again, given the lower rates than some of its competitors closer to the Michigan Avenue shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Your Staff ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2BTravelling
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago is *amazing*! I have to admit...I have *never* known hotel staff to be so accommodating! I was a bit frazzled when I arrived, due to a fender bender on the freeway, but your staff made me feel as if I was truly THE most important person in the world and they took care of me from the start! They were friendly, welcoming, caring and WONDERFUL! (I can't even begin to tell you how much that means to me!) After feeling relieved to make it there (after a tough drive)...I was met by a charming, young valet, who made the whole valet process seem SO easy and he eased my mind considerably! The lovely woman at the front desk made the check-in process seem so easy and even if my room was still being prepared ...I felt that she truly cared about my experience and she put my mind at ease as well! I went to Angels & Kings to have a quick drink...and the friendly bartender was very helpful, as he made me aware of what he had available. I also asked him if he would kindly open the bottle of wine that I brought, since I had forgotten a corkscrew and he gladly did so! He also made sure I had a couple of wine glasses. I wish I could remember their names, but I've forgotten now. I arrived at approximately 4:00 p.m. 3-15-12 and left the next day, so that should help identify them. In addition, the room was lovely and the views of Chicago were *magnificent* from every window! (I stayed in a Tower Suite.) Thank you for your excellence!

Reviews.Title: “Great !!”
Reviews.Author: jfv3
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay and I recommend this hotel. The location is great and the staff was nice and friendly. The lobby bar is very coo but a little pricy

Reviews.Title: “True to it's name......it rocked!”
Reviews.Author: tiggerlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on an amazing warm weekend for Chicago in February, excellent location for walking around Michigan Ave, and vincinity. Staff was very friendly and helpful, front desk personnel were awesome, my man loved the Fender Guitars, he tried two different ones during our stay. Concierge recommended a great Jazz Supper Club in walking distance, Andy's Jazz club on Hubbard, awesome jazz bands, food and service also. Room was comfortable, immaculate with great view of the city. We had an issue wth people in next room being loud the first night, staff and security were quick to check and things settled down. I've stayed at several of the hotels on Michigan Ave. and vincinity and the Hard Rock has just became one of my favorites, we are looking forward to coming back and staying again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: Tipsy252
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed 2 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel over Christmas last year. We arrived at the hotel around 4pm on Christmas day and were given a tower king room on the 32nd floor, amazing views of Michigan Ave. I had alreadt contacted Scott the concierge for suggestions of restaurants in the area that would be open but as we had had a long flight and due to the time difference we opted to eat at China Grill in the hotel. Good choice! There are lots of convenience stores round about and a Starbucks down the road, handy for coffee or breakfast muffin. All in all a great stay with some good service at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Hasn't Had A Hit SInce Vinyl...”
Reviews.Author: Secretariat1973
Reviews.Content: I had this image in my mind that the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago was going to be edgy, chic and ultra hip Art Deco. After all, isn't it advertised to have hosted celebs and rock stars? Located on centrally located Michigan Avenue in downtown Chicago, the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago is housed in the iconic Carbide & Carbon building, a historic Burnham masterpiece fashioned from green terra cotta and black polished granite. I couldnt wait to check in. I walked into a strange, narrow passageway known as the Lobby. Angels and Kings lounge anchors one end, while a somewhat empty room facing Michigan Avenue holds a not-for-championship play billiards table. The drab, utilitarian front desk and facing Concierge station are dimly lit even during the day. An oddly out of place, has-not-been-cleaned-in-who-knows-when, bar with only two stools sat outside of Angels and Kings. So far, not good. There was literally nothing going on in or around the lobby or sidewalk area, so the hotel was obviously relatively empty. I checked in on a Sunday afternoon in a non holiday, cold and dreary time of the year. Given the less than capacity status, I requested a courtesy upgrade to a Tower room, which was denied. I did get an end/corner room on the 21st floor with 4 windows, which was nice. It faced the rear of a really ugly old building on one side, and I could look into the rooms of what appeared to be either a lower priced office building or tiny apartments on the other side. The room's windows had shades plus decorator cool grey wool flannel drapes, which kept out the light at night and early morning hours. It was clean and furnished in an Art Deco motif, but the mattress was probably from the era of the Nixon Administration, and was quite tattered and far from luxurious. There was one ugly framed black and white photo of a man I didnt recognize on the wall and a mirror above the bed. Stepping off the elevator onto the 21st floor was like stepping into an ugly warehouse. Scarred walls, nondescript paint and no hint of decoration on the entire floor. The doors to the rooms looked like they had been lifted from a salvaged building, and the carpeting could not have been a worse choice. Apparently meant to resemble the pattern of sound wave, it fell short of any sort of musical quality. Dirty dishes and glasses with something disgusting resembling vomit sat outside of a couple of the rooms for a day and a half. Housekeeping pointed the finger at the In-Room Dining Department, and someone finally removed them from the hallway. The Hard Rock Hotels advertise that every floor is dedicated to a musician or group. The 21st floor of The Hard Rock Chicago must have been a nod to a one hit One-Der, which was never seen or heard from again. Nothing at all like the floor where the Executive Offices and business room are located -- which displays a huge photo of Mick Jagger on one wall and a giant shadowbox holding a suit and a title card indicating it to have been worn by Keith Richards directly across the room. I presumed that floor was where business conferences are held, and those companies paying big bucks to impress invited attendees need something to justify the rental fees. The Angels and Kings Lounge boasted having your photograph turned into a mug shot, which would then be projected onto the wall first seen when entering the lounge. I didn't quite see the excitement in projecting one's self as a felon on the way through criminal processing at the Cook County slammer. An Asian restaurant was featured in the in-room guide to the Hotel, which apparently closed down some time ago. Electric guitars can be 'borrowed' by guests, to the tune of a $500 hold/deposit on your credit card. There is no pool, and no guest hot tub. There is a gift shop down the ramp from the Lobby, featuring supremely overpriced Hard Rock themed clothing, jewelry and other souvenier quality items for tourists too lazy to explore the exciting shops Chicago proper has to offer. A huge sign on the window of the Hard Rock facing Michigan advertised rooms for $99/night. For a moment I wondered if The Hard Rock Hotel Chicago was really just a front for a YMCA. I sure wish I had gotten that $99 deal. Unfortunately, it still would have been too much. The Hard Rock Hotel Chicago is like a has-been starlet of a certain age, trying to project an image from the cool rock days of the 80s. Sadly, in harsh daylight its just an older hotel desperately in need of a facelift. No wonder the front desk staff seems so down.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay - wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cuddles55
Reviews.Content: Ny hubby and I have just returned from a 5 night break to Chicago where we stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel - we had a wonderful time staying there although a sour note to finish was being presented with a bar bill for two large bottles of water ( costing $9.60 each!!!!) which we never had and we didn't even open the mini bar/fridge in the room for the whole stay ( as we had read from a previous reviewer about the 'movement sensors in the bar/fridge,') When I queried this bill at reception, I did get the bill cleared, with no actual apology but with the words 'Oh, I suppose I have to trust you'!!!!! I was a little taken aback at this but took the matter no further as the stay we had the hotel was lovely apart from that incident. I would return this holiday again and would recommend it to couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: CodeForSomething
Reviews.Content: Rooms were updated and location was perfect! Rooms aren't huge and the restaurant/bar and lobby are very small but serves its purpose...I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cosmo930
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. We had free valet parking with our room rate, so that was great too. Staff is very friendly. Hotel is ok, not as chic as I had expected. Clearly another hotel that has been "upgraded" and refurbished and made into the Hard Rock. We wanted to check out a guitar, but the ones we wanted were not available. The whole place was too warm.. We were there in winter and had to open our window because it was so warm. Excellent location. Close to everything. We walked to Frontera. For breakfast, you must try Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe, just a few blocks away, its fantastic!!! Walgreens right across the street from the hotel too, which is nice. Beds were very very comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: jla_7
Reviews.Content: I'm really impressed! Room was quite nice. Clean, quiet, comfortable. Free wi-fi if you book online.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: LadyP228
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights as a first time visitor and I had a wonderful time!!! It was my 35th birthday weekend. The staff was the Ace of Spades! Shout out to Darlene (didnt think of the Willis Tower until you said it and Iit was truly a highlight!!!), Eddie (your tha bomb-dig-a-dee), J.B (#1 and Duece (lol)),Tony& Bob (protect n serve), Corey(thanks for tha party info) and the entire Angels and Kings staff for making my weekend pop like popcorn!!! Hotel was clean staff was helpful. Access to the shops on Michigan Ave was awesome!. Walking distance to erthang!!! To the midnight shift..Kisses for dealing with my insomnia I really enjoy yall! truly unforgettable...Thank You!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room but loud noises throughout the night from elevator.”
Reviews.Author: JEREMYandDEANNE
Reviews.Content: The Good LOCATION Views Decor Room Service Friendly Staff The Bad Shower curtain in replacement room was too short and leaked Bed was just Ok The Ugly Had to pack our bags again and change rooms after loud noises from the elevator kept us up. I am a heavy sleeper but even with my white noise app cranked on the hotel's iPod dock it was still loud enough to keep me up. Also our toilet leaked into a puddle by the shower. The staff did however provide a replacement room although not immediately. Also, they mentioned that they had AREADY been aware of the noise problem with that room from past customers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fun Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed at this property last year, we woke in the morning to find the entire property without hot water....in December. Not fun. This stay was so much more pleasant. The service from the front desk staff was quick and courteous, the lobby and spacious rooms were clean and well decorated and the location right on Michigan Avenue can't be beat. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: kropee10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Chicago on a weekend trip to Chicago because of a coupon on Living Social for half off a night's stay. The hotel is in a really good location on Michigan Ave (between the Magnificient Mile shopping and the Millenium Park/Art Institute) so we were able to walk everywhere. Also, there was a parking garage on the same block so there would not be a hassle to park (we did use valet though to get the full 'rock star' experience). The hotel itself was very 'rock star': everything was black, grey or dark purple and dark. Our room and bathroom were decent sized; the furnishings were sparse but fit the theme. We had a corner room on the 7th floor with nice views of the skyline. The room service was also good, not exceptional but satisfying. Since neither of us play guitar, we did not take advantage of the free Fender rental; I was too nervous about breaking it to attempt it. The drawback with the hotel was noise; the doors allow for noise to come through and street noise was audible. And because its a 'rock and roll' hotel, the other guests like to enjoy in rock and roll behavior (aka loud). We did not take advantage of the China Grill or Angels & Kings club to review them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: teez52
Reviews.Content: For the price I got, this was a fantastic deal! The rooms were very clean and very modern. The view from our room left a little bit to be desired, but we didn't go to Chicago for the room view. The hotel is very secure as you need your key card to use the elevators. It's relatively close to the "L" stations too.

Reviews.Title: “Took the Travelocity Reps advice...”
Reviews.Author: DeadMansParty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took an un-scheduled trip to Chicago, IL this past weekend for our birthdays. The Travelocity rep said the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago off of Michigan was a 4 star rated hotel and recommended it. I normally check stuff like this out before going on a trip but this time I let her handle the trip. I decided to read the reviews the next day on tripadvisor and was pleasantly surprised that there were quite a few 5 star ratings and those with issues were acknowledged my management. I could only hope it was this good for us. Fast forward to the next business and my Positive review of the Hard Rock. It was Great. The room was nice and spacious and the location to everything was a nice perk too. We pretty much didn't try anything else at the hotel since we were out and about everyday till late but everytime I needed directions somewhere or a recommendation, the Concierge was more than happy to help us out...Nice guys. Just to add we decided to be adventurous and take the CTA from O'Hare to downtown Chicago and I was not disappointed there either. The "L" train, or Blue line, gets you to Clark and Lake, where we needed to get off, and walk down to Michigan and the hotel is around the corner from there. Compared to a 30-40 dollar cab ride, we paid $2.75 a ticket each one way and it was safe. So put the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago on your list of places to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, hip hotel.”
Reviews.Author: packer12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our 20th wedding anniversary weekend. Bellhop was great. Gave us 4 free passes for drinks. Concierge gave us free comedy passes. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Informal but very nice”
Reviews.Author: redinked
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the hotel and we both enjoyed the stay. I especially felt at home because the personnel did not wear costumes like some hotels have their bellman and valets wear; this is a fine hotel that does not make you feel that you do not belong there. It has a very nice fitness center, at no charge and open 24 hours. The location is terrific, close to museums and shopping as well as restaurants. If you want a stuffy hotel that is very formal don't come here. If you want a good time, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just average”
Reviews.Author: krochetwo
Reviews.Content: Very loud ! Great location. Upgraded to a corner king . Nice views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a good location but not thrilled with the room”
Reviews.Author: Gene63
Reviews.Content: It is a vary nice hotel with an excellent staff and terrific location But the hall and room was monochromatic everything was GRAY or close to it. A bit to much. Maybe it is my age 40+ but I travel a lot and I think the biggest drawback of the hotel was the lighting in the room. It was dark for me, nevermind my wife having a bigger problem with it when trying to get ready and applying makeup. She could not see if it was on properly and I couldn't even really tell her until outside. This is what I think could be an easy fix. Other than the lighting everything else would have bene Great. She LOVED the Martini bar, a little pricy but Great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: kittym
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to be in Chicago for a Barry Manilow concert and had looked for a hotel within walking distance of The Chicago Theatre. I ended up booking a room at the Hard Rock on-line, a prepaid nonrefundable rate that was the best I found for the date I needed. Well, the week of the show, the Manilow concert got rescheduled to July due to medical reasons! So here I sat with a reservation and train tickets and no show to go to with my sister who ended up not wanting to go to Chicago and spend additional money she didn't have. I had called the hotel to see if there was any way I could get the reservation switched to July, realizing it was nonrefundable. Although it was against their policy, they were willing to assist me due to the circumstances. However, the July rate would have been close to $100 more than the February rate, and since a lot could happen between now and then, I chose not to accept their offer. I called them back to leave the message. Then within a few minutes, I received a call at home thanking me for keeping the existing reservation! Long story short, my husband came to Chicago with me instead of my sister, just for a quick overnight getaway, so as not to waste the prepaid room. Upon check in at rush hour traffic on Friday afternoon, we were upgraded to a "city view room" without asking and at no additional charge. The demeanor of the desk clerk was fantastic and he made us feel very welcome. It is a very historic, tall and narrow building, and our "city view" ended up being on the 18th floor with two windows looking directly into the windows of buildings across the streets, but the third corner window overlooked the Chicago river with a great view of the "corn cob" towers as well. I agree with some other reviews about the "darkness", but I think that is due to the primarily gray color scheme of the halls and rooms along with heavy drapes. However, there were plenty of lights in the room, a fantastic lounge chair with built in footstool and a brand new Rolling Stone magazine, as well as a huge bathroom with nice amenities. We thought about eating at the hotel, but unfortunately, the China restaurant had recently closed and we didn't have the opportunity to check out Angels and Kings, but the location of the hotel is great for walking the State Street shopping district or heading to Millennium Park or the "museum campus". There are certainly plenty of eating options within easy walking distance as well. We also didn't explore each floor of the hotel to check out the "rock memorabilia", but would if we stayed there again. (We were on the Tina Turner floor). I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to visitors looking for a location south of the river!

Reviews.Title: “You really feel like a rock star!!”
Reviews.Author: cll7911
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Chicago Hard Rock Hotel in December last year and had a great time! As soon as you walk into the hotel you feel like you are a welcomed guest and it continues through the entire hotel. Staff at check-in are very very nice. The room we had looked just like the pictures of the rooms on the website (That does not happen very often). We will be back to stay again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was a great hotel, would definitely stay there again. Great location and staff was nice. Area recommendations Stay on the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Ave), you can reach anything downtown from the Hard Rock Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rooms so dark you can barely see”
Reviews.Author: sdgamer
Reviews.Content: I understand that the hotel is creating this atmosphere of being at a concert or something, but seriously I could barely see in my room. I turned all the lights on. Other colleagues who stayed there told me the same thing. Good location with lots within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free visit”
Reviews.Author: froaction
Reviews.Content: First of all got a great online rate for our stay in January. I am sure peak summer season that the prices will be more expensive. This is a great hotel right on Michigan Avenue. About a block to the Chicago river. Walking distance to many great sites including all the MIchigan Avenue shopping, Millennium Park, multiple restaurants and bars. A little bit of a hike to Grant Park and the museums but not bad. Public transportation is close by with the L , bus service etc.. Very easy train ride to from O'hare. The Clark/Lake train stop is very close by and you can walk it or grab a cab if you have multiple bags. The train ride cost 2.25 per person each way. A cab or car service will run you 55.00 plus tip each way. The front desk was polite and helpful. Our concierge Scott was A+. I had some places I already knew about but he was spot on with his recommendations. We had a king corner room. Not sure the size difference with other rooms but it was big enough for our two person stay. No noise problems at all. The housekeeping service was great with daily cleaning. I didn't use room service or the hotel bar or restaurants. But the bar looked like it would be fun and busy on a weekend. Again if you can get a good rate then I see no problem staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “dynamic pricing... beware!”
Reviews.Author: MissWisc
Reviews.Content: I went to visit a friend who was staying at this hotel on business. I knew they'd paid a corporate rate of under $100 a night but the first quote I got online was for $250 a night for a single king room and prices went up from there. I called to see if I could get a cheaper rate and the woman who took my call rudely told me that "online was my best chance." By checking online every day, I was able to find the same room about 10 days later for $129 (an "online $50 discount) and booked the visit. I knew I'd be arriving late night so I called that afternoon to confirm and let them know when I would arrive. They made a note of it in my file and the desk clerk greeted me by name upon arrival - nice touch! The room itself was lovely - big comfy bed, lots of hot water in a huge shower, nice TV and the rock photos/memorabilia make the hotel a fun place to explore. It's easy walking distance to the theater district, art museum and right on Michigan Avenue for all that shopping. The Concierge was excellent - even by Chicago standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good rooms, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ottawagirlCanada
Reviews.Content: We go to CHI every year for a Bears game. This year we stayed at the Hard Rock on Michigan, We walked to the game (30 minutes). The subway is very close. The hotel itself has nothing spectacular. But the staff is fantastic. Very helpful and quick! The room was clean (one thinkg though: I just hated the fact that the sheet to cover the mattress was too small. I always ended up waking up touching the actual mattress. I am not a neat freak but did not like the feeling!). There is a safe in the room which is great. Overall, I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: This has been my 5th or 6th time staying at the Hard Rock for business. My first review pointed out that the hotel was consistent and a good value. However, there have been some improvements and also some issues that I want to point out during my last stay. The positives include a great concierge and very helpful front desk staff. In addition, once in awhile, they will upgrade you which makes a huge difference if you can get a Tower Suite, as the view is incredible. Also, the Hard Rock is relatively cheap and adequate for business travel, with a decent bar. Now, I have some minor gripes after my latest stay. The bathroom was NOT very clean and was in serious need of some cleaning. The products they give you are like paint thinner, so bring your own shampoo and soap. The decor is fine, modern and chic, but seems a bit....run down. I hear they are renovating, so perhaps I was in an old room? Also, we called maintenance to fix the heat. They didn't show up. The location is great as it is at the top corner of the Loop but also near the park and shopping. For the right price, like rock bottom, I may stay here again, but they need to make some updates. There are far too many other choices in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel teh weekend of Jan 14-15. Booked though hotels tonight for $105 total including taxes. First impression was only "Wow!" I don't think I've ever stayed at such a chic place before. The lobby has a modenist design with chairs and couches spread though out. The carpets have a great design with soundwaves printed on them. Each floor is named after a musician and has a great mural of them on a wall and has a case with some memorbilia as well. We were given a 19th floor room which was impeccably clean. The room had a great vibe with sleek stylish funiture and comfortable queen bed. The little reading lights above the bed were a nice touch. I like to read at night and my wife is a light sleeper and they didn't bother her at all. The same chic vibe continued to the bathroom with modern fixtures and lighting. It was a shower only with no tub which is fine for my wife and I. The shampoo and shower gels were particularly good. So, good that my wife went down to the Hard Rock Shop and puchased a full sized shower gel for home. The only drawback to the room in general was the shower couldn't be closed all the way. It had a half plane of glass that couldn't be closed so it was off putting but by no means a reason not to stay there again. If anything it was that I just wasn't used to the design. A note about parking. Valet is $50 a night and there is limited self parking that's about a half block away and $35 a night. Now, this is standard for Chicago and while high it's something that you'd have to pay no matter where you stay. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The rooms are swank with nice music touches all around. A great hotel and I will certainly be staying here again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend....”
Reviews.Author: Mariboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago and had a great experience. From the valet parking to checking in was super easy. We got therebefore the 3:00pm check in time, but since our room was ready, they let us check in early. Our room and view was great!!! The rooms are pretty modern and each floor has a rock star theme! The location is close to shopping and not too far from Millennium park. You can pretty much walk everywhere. There is also a Walgreens right in front of the hotel in case you forget anything. We had to check out by noon, but we still had plans, so they can check your bags and you can come back and get them when your done. They also have the Chicago Tribune for free in the lobby for there guest, which I thought was great! Let me know if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “A nice (if loud) hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luvtravels33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The accommodations were nice - comfortable and clean. In my room, the only issue I encountered was with the mini bar - I did not realize that every time you remove an item (even if it's just to read the label), they place it on your bill. It's an easy fix (they removed the charges) but could be an expensive mistake for those who weren't paying attention when they payed their bills. Other than that, the sleeping room was fine, and I would consider returning (for business or leisure travel). I would not recommend it for business travel, though. The food was somewhat pricey, making it difficult to stay within my per diem. The bigger concern was that the conference room had a constant humming/vibration, which made the conference less than enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool Atmosphere, Some Minor Glitches”
Reviews.Author: mamber-m
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for three nights for business, in January 2012. Overall, I like the hotel and definitely considering coming back next time I come to the windy city. The bed was comfortable, although I wanted warmer blankets. Water pressure of the shower was good. Bathroom was clean. Pros: Great location (close to the intersection of Wacker and Michigan). Cool, boutique-hotel atmosphere (see the photo). My room (on the 18th floor) has a decently good view of the river and the highrises along the Wacker drive. Large room. Efficient check out (didn't need to drop by at the reception). Friendly (a bit too casual for me though) staff. Cool lobby area (with free wifi). Cons: Towels were not very soft. Used for a long time it seems. One of the elevators did not work one day. The iPhone compatible stereo system did not work well (did not recognize my iPhone well). The lumps were unplugged when I entered the room. Do I need to pay $13 for Wifi in the room? The public area Wifi was not too reliable. My floor (18th) was themed in honor of Tina Turner, not my favourite artist... I wish I could have chosen... Overall (except for not too comfy towels) cons were minor, and i definitely think about coming back. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jenifaabadabing
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel - our room was beautiful and really well themed with Chris Martin on the wall and even tiny guitars embroidered on the pillows. The weather was dreadful the whole time we were there so lucky the room was so nice as we spent so much time in it!! The staff were great and helpful with where to go, it being our first trip to Chicago. The building itself is incredible! Each floor is themed for a musical artist and it's quite fun to just take a ride up the floors and check out all the different costumes/instruments/etc. The best thing about the hotel is that they let you borrow an electric guitar for free for the duration of your stay, which my boyfriend LOVED (although it took hours for them to actually bring it to our room having requested it, so make sure you ask when you check in if you want one for maximum guitar time). Very central hotel, perfect for a citybreak, and we got a really reasonable rate too.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Joan W
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for our sons 16th birthday. We chose the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago. From the minute we arrived they were wonderful. Our room was wonderful and the staff was awesome. The staff was so helpful with places to eat, places to go, my husband needed a phone charger and they had one to us in seconds. They also made our son feel very special for his special weekend. They made his and our experience GREAT! We will be going back and we will definitely stay at the Hard Rock Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Made for a special night”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night we got engaged. Despite the fact that we used a groupon, they upgraded us to a corner room, gave us free drinks at the bar, and could not have been more fantastic to deal with. Clearly the service was great. The room itself exceeded all expectations. Bright and comfy room, with views to the North up Michigan Ave. and to the East and the lake. While it's an older building and the windows aren't huge, the room was big, clean and decked out with cool artwork and furniture. WIth a location on Michigan Avenue just south of the River, anything you might want to do in the loop or Magnificent Mile area is within walking distance. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Renovation of Art-Deco property”
Reviews.Author: vttico
Reviews.Content: I'd admired this beautiful Art-Deco building and it's place in the Chicago skyline before I moved away back in 1989. I was really pleased and surprised to walk up to its entrance on Michigan Avenue and to learn that the gorgeous gold lobby had been preserved! I had booked a room as part of an incredible promotion ($99!) expecting to feel out-of-place, but my husband and I (in our late 50's) really enjoyed our stay at the Hard Rock (classic rock music and memorabilia throughout the property). Very comfortable room with a nice view of adjacent skyscrapers, very good staff. When you stay here, be sure to walk over a couple of the bridges spanning the Chicago River, which is just steps away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Back again, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Panther67
Reviews.Content: We have been to Chicago 3 times in the last year and we stay at the Hard Rock Hotel on Michigan Ave. everytime. We love this hotel because of the location. We park our car and don't use it for our entire stay. You can walk to the "Magnificent Mile" for shopping, you can walk to to Millenium Park, you can walk to many restaurants including our favourite, Pizano's on Madison. We buy a CTA pass at the Walgreens across the street and ride the Loop to the Museums and the Aquarium. The hotel is a boutique style of hotel with their rock theme which we love. The hotel is clean and modern in an old classic building. The guys at the concierge are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Oldies love it too!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara D
Reviews.Content: We are in our late sixties and absolutely loved this hotel (got one nite stay as a Christmas gift from our kids). Hey what can be better than waking up to the Beatles in your bathroom! We stayed on Jimi Hendrix floor and wish I could remember the quote etched on the mirror above the bed. Something about fire/desire? Great bartender-Ergis

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: kyleej0y
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! The rooms were big and clean, the staff was very helpful and friendly, and the location was perfect right on the magnificent mile. I will definitely be staying there again! It did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Rockin in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Deborah R
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip that I was traveling by myself which can be a little nerve wrecking, especially to a big city where you don't know anyone. That changed after talking with all of the staff. They were all so welcoming and always had smiles on their faces which really can turn your mood around. This was by far the best hotel I have stayed at (and I have worked at a resort!) I wish I would have remembered the names of the staff members but they all were so wonderful, especially the bellmen and the concierge. Even the morning I was leaving, the gal in the gift shop was super friendly (talked about Arizona where I am from) and I left with a smile. I also really enjoyed all of the decor on the different floors. I stayed on the beatles floor which I was really stoked about. My room was very clean and loved the bed! I ordered room service which the gentleman was polite and the food was delivered quite fast. My trip was only one day... I know next time to book it for a longer stay. Definitely would recommend staying here while in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Good Room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: thbergs
Reviews.Content: After being dissapointed that we couldn't get the discount rate we saw, the Hotel responded to our e-mail by allowing us the rate. Then, from the friendly staff upon arrival checking us in early, to the keeping of our bags until train time, we had great service. Special thanks for the success of our trip go to Concierge Shelia Garg. She really tuned in to what we wanted to experience, and gave us great recommandations on sites, transportation (though we mostly walked since the weather cooperated and it is a great area to walk in) and especially great eats! Our room was the lowest price point, so not the greatest view, although a neighboring building had a nice Christmas tree display on the roof top. Noise was not an issue, bed was comfy. We didn't get the room to our usual cooler temp for sleeping, not sure if it was opperator error or what. Another night and we might have had it? Only real issues were with the bathroom. Very dark, vent didn't work, used Kleenex in the trash can and no shampoo. We did not make a complaint, so not sure what they would have done to fix anything. I am not real high maintanence, so got by by guessing the make-up was OK, leaving the door open after shower to air it out and using shampoo from home. Our own kleenex went into the trash as well, and the rest of the room seemed to have been cleaned, so I think the cleaner just didn't see it in the trash can and empty it. Our room had just a shower, no tub, which I longed for a nice hot soak after walking, but I think had I payed attention, the info on the room stated that. Hotel had great character, even though we spent little time in it. Didn't eat or have a drink there, so no review on that. Good location for what we wanted and a nice stay. Again. mostly due to Shelia being so great at her job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Price”
Reviews.Author: eatingfromindy
Reviews.Content: This hotel really met our needs. My husband and I spent a Friday and Saturday night here and wanted to be able to walk to shopping on Michigan Avenue. We easily walked to shopping and restaurants on Friday night and Saturday afternoon. For the area the price was great and the parking was cheaper than other nearby hotels. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Atmosphere was fun and the rooms were of adequate size for our needs. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: anderjim
Reviews.Content: Groovy, hostoric building located perfectly for Mag Mile sightseeing, Navy Pier, Art Institute, Aquarium & Planetarium. We had a fabulous corner room with double queen beds and amazing bathroom with giant, powerful shower. All the mod cons plus iPod docking station and excellent coffee machine. Housekeeping were a little mean with the coffee supply, so I asked for extra Jet Fuel capsules and they repsonded with more than enough. The staff were all really helpful, enthusiastic and friendly, adding to an overall feeling of informal luxury, which is right up our alley. Beds were very comfortable, and the room was extremely quiet. There was plenty of lighting, except in the closet hallway, in which there was barely any light. It made dressing a bit of a hassle, to be honest. A small concern in an overall excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that is close to everything in the Loop.”
Reviews.Author: Laxw09
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this HRH twice now and will certainly stay again. The location can't be beat. It's easy to walk everywhere and really feels like it's in the heart of the city. It's also very simple to get to the El. Prices are reasonable (comparatively against other places in Chicago) and they offer occasional discounts if you sign up for their email list. It is always very clean and the staff is friendly. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but....”
Reviews.Author: KP&TP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HRH Chicago for three nights as a delayed anniversary trip, and had a great time. Not sure that we would stay at the property again when choosing a four star hotel. Here are our thoughts: The Good: Location of the hotel was excellent, we could walk pretty much anywhere we wanted to go in downtown Chicago, and the train station was just about four blocks away for more distant locations. Lots of good to great restaurants nearby. The bed was comfortable and had enough pillows. The second room we were in (an upgraded corner King for an additional $30 per night) was large and had four large windows with a great view of the river. The room was quiet, hardly ever heard any noise from the hallway at all. All staff members we interacted with were helpful, friendly and enthusiastic, particularly the concierge. The Bad: While the bed was comfortable, the sheets were not great, a little too small and kind of cheap for a four star. The towels also weren't great - kind of scratchy and thin. The rooms (we saw two) could definitely use some refurbishing. The furniture and walls were definitely showing their age. There were dings, scratches, crumbling corners, etc. everywhere. Bar none, this was the most "petite" closet ever. Where do people put their shoes???? The bathroom. We were speechless when we first walked in and it got worse from there. Our room was handicap enabled, so the shower had no barrier at all from the rest of the room. There were loose tiles and missing grout (I mean a LOT of missing grout, not just a couple of little spots), plus a lot of the grout that was still in place looked dirty. The magnifying mirror on the wall didn't light up and also wouldn't stay in place (drooped downwards) so it was essentially useless. There was extremely limited counter space and no towel bar (other than the handicap rail next to the toilet), so after washing your hands you had to step across the room to get to a hand towel. The toilet seat wouldn't stay up when needed, it would slam down. Not cool for the hubby..... The room was not very clean. For instance, we had a spiderweb in the corner, and when hopping up on the bed to put my mascara on (there was a mirror over the bed), the top of the headboard looked as though it hadn't been cleaned for quite a while. I am not a neat freak but really don't like a dirty hotel room. Yuck. The maids never replenished our bath products. Usually they leave extra, especially when people tip but we didn't get replacements. I would have liked more lotion for the dry weather. The lack of shampoo/conditioner didn't matter to us, since there wasn't enough water pressure for me to wash my hair anyway. My hair is long and thick and it would have taken about 1/2 hour to rinse out in that shower. So all in all, I would have to say that we probably would not choose to stay at this property again unless it was refurbished and we had a different type of bathroom. We had a great time because we chose to focus on the positives and enjoyed each other's company and the great city of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Nice Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: kt1980_98
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock for my hudband's work party. Great Location, Friendly Helpful Staff. Very Clean Hotel, right in the center of it all. We had lunch at a Pub around the corner called Emerald Loop, very good irish pub within walking distance. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Newman1
Reviews.Content: Spend one night at The Hard Rock. Love the location right on Michigan Ave with walking distance to almost everything. The room was clean, quiet and cool. The carpet and furniture showed very little signs of wear. The themes on each floor are make this more like a museum than a hotel. I was pleasantly suprise with quality of the hotel. Rock on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Sandra R
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in the Windy City. I used a GroupOn for a Saturday night stay. Great location. Right in the middle of all the shopping. Our room was large and immaculate. The staff was great. They could not have been friendlier. They were very knowledgable about the area and offered up suggestions. I would definitely stay here again. The GroupOn just made it that much sweeter.

Reviews.Title: “IMPECCABLY CLEAN & OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: LapDog88
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock Hotel Chicago has both of these important yet hard to find amenities to offer along with an excellent location and very modern floor to floor Rock themes that will provide a unique hotel experience for travelers of all ages! I was exceptionally impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel along with the outstanding customer service provided by the Hard Rock staff. The Hard Rock Hotel Chicago has set the bar at the top and is determined to keep it there. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the downtown Chicago area as I feel it will exceed your expectations and provide you with a great value for your money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: hcod07
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and will stay again. We got a promo for Valentine's Day for $99 (plus tax) per night! I even fell in town and the hotel provided me with an ice pack.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoThereYesterday
Reviews.Content: Great location on Michigan Avenue-you can walk anywhere including Millennium Park and Intelligentsia Coffee (DO NOT go to Starbucks when there's an Intelligentsia another block away!) Room was clean and modern. Bed was soft & comfy. Didn't hear a soul in the hallway the entire time. We were on 23 facing North with a great view but definitely heard sirens throughout the night. Strange, because we usually stay just around the corner at Hotel Monaco and I don't remember ever hearing sirens over there.. FYI: Parking was $46/night (which is par for Michigan Ave.) I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Amy P
Reviews.Content: Very cool place to stay! Great atmospher & room view from the Jimi Hendrix 19th floor. Walking distance from good food and fun things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed a one-night stay (aided by a Groupon purchase), are are happy to recommend HRH Chicago to others. Can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock really does ROCK!”
Reviews.Author: Mark D
Reviews.Content: There is no better location to take advantage of all the Chicago highlights, restaurants, shopping, theaters, etc. in the downtown loop. The room price was great, but the customer service exhibited by the entire staff made the stay an even greater value. (Concierge Sheila Garg is the best in the business - she literally ran three blocks to help my group get on the proper trolley tour bus!) Bathrooms - spotless. Mattress - perfect. My room overlooked Michigan Avenue, but I could hear nothing from the street below. Take advantage of the complimentary electric guitar with hotel-friendly headphones, even if you don't play one (like me). It was educational just to see one up close! I will stay at the Hard Rock Chicago during future trips to the Windy City and will seek out Hard Rock properties elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Karly J
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel, it was really clean (it met my high standards) and comfortable! The decor was obviously consistent with touristy Hard Rock feel (which didn't contribute much to my opinion of the hotel). Additionally, it was in the perfect downtown location, and was a great place to make your home base on a trip to Chicago! The general feel was clean and comfortable, and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Connie W
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 15th floor, Elvis floor and our room faced north up Michigan Avenue. Everyone was very nice, brought us more towels right away, gave me our free wifi code when I asked for it....I thought I had a great deal of $134/night for 2 nights, but then I heard someone saying they had rooms for $90!! The beds in our room were a little too soft for me, the counter space in the bathroom was rather limited, and there are lots of sirens going on all night, but that's the city for you. My husband is a Paramedic and said "what sirens?" I think twice in 2 days did we have to share an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: SpoiledVacationers
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at Hard Rock for business, great location, close to Millennium Park and on Michigan Ave. Pros: * Great location: central to many downtown top sites and restaurants. Friendly Service: since I had no special requests, the check-in experience was friendly and prompt. * Nice complementary looking rooms. Cons: * None.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly staff and cool rooms”
Reviews.Author: TDubsInLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely exceeded my expectations. I've stayed at a couple of other Hard Rock properties prior to this in resort destinations (Vegas and Bali) but never one in a primarily urban location for a business trip. I don't really consider myself to be their target demographic and the hotel lacks some of the things a business traveller wants BUT it does make up for it in style and service. What I liked: - free WiFi (if you're a hotel that isn't offering free WiFi you're irritating your guests with the nickel & diming) - incredibly friendly and helpful staff - room looked great, very hip & stylish - room was huge and well laid out - really liked the smell of the bath products - great views and lots of huge windows - the hotel is located in one Chicago's most beautiful old buildings - I ordered room service twice and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food What I wished they would improve on: - bed wasn't that comfortable (mattress and sheets not great quality) - not enough plugs at the desk - no bathrobes (helpful for greeting the room service person bringing you breakfast) All in all, I would gladly recommend this hotel to a friend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: DannyP23
Reviews.Content: We just got home from staying at the Hard Rock for three nights and I must say I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. Every thing about it was pretty awesome. They had some of the best customer service I have ever had. If you wanted to go anywhere their concierge would book it for you or make great suggestions as to where to go. The maids were great too. She asked me what time I would like my room cleaned and even if I needed anything anything extra. I even got to rent a complimentary electric guitar for the duration of my stay. This was a couples trip and we all had a great time. The night life was great but if you do want to go to a club you need to get there really early for the more high end ones. We also went to almost all the museums and those were all fantastic. Another good thing is the location of the hotel. Its pretty much located in the middle of everything. Whether we walked to the museums or to the end of the "Magnificent Mile" to the Cheese Cake Factory it only took about 20 minutes (which to us was better then taking a $12 cab ride one way). Plus the women liked to walk because they did all their shopping on the way to the destinations. Overall it was a great place to stay. The only issue is that it was a little pricey. Valet parking was $46 a night but I guess that is expected in a big city. The actual rooms were very nice and it had that classy/ modern feel to the entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: murrayhill
Reviews.Content: Had a one-night business trip, and when my usual haunts were booked because of several conventions, I found a room here. What a revelation. First off, location right on North Michigan is great. A very short walk to the Magnificent Mile and a boatload of great restaurants. Service was very welcoming from the start. No rock-star attitude. My room on the 17th floor, um, rocked. Not only was it extremely spacious, but it had some of the highest ceilings I've experienced in a hotel, to give one a very airy, almost loft-like feel. The modern, yet not austere decor was complemented by a large flat-screen TV with an ample selection of channels, an easy-to-navigate clock radio with an iPod dock and a mirror over the bed that quoted Annie Lennox. "Sweet dreams are made of these." Indeed. My room overlooked Michigan Avenue and I was able to see the lake in the distance. One thing you need to remember is to close the curtains for all the windows, especially in the bathroom. You're right in the middle of a business district and there are plenty of offices where people could see you doing your, er, business if you're not careful. Fortunately, I caught wind of that in time. And despite the name and moniker of the hotel, it was as quiet as I wanted it to be. Virtually no noise from other rooms or the hallway. Wi-Fi is free if you book online. You can also get free coffee and papers in the lobby. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like the "Funky Cool" vibe and themed floors but rooms were a little too dark”
Reviews.Author: BRH1180
Reviews.Content: Great Location, right on Michigan Ave in the heart of downtown & directly across the street from a Walgreens (came in handy daily). Staff was great - always helpful! Beds were comfy which is HUGE! My only complaint, and it's kind of a big one, is the lighting in the rooms...it was so dark! I never really knew for sure if I was presentable when I left for the day, haha.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: was only able to stay for single night due to a large conference in the chicago area that week. this hotel was great - staff was friendly, super clean from the lobby to the rooms, spacious, luxury type decorations, and the service during my repeated calls was impeccable. two very small faults were that there was an amount of street noise - i sleep heavy so no issue for me, but a light sleeper may struggle, and i found the signage of the hotel lacking - the hotel is in the carbide building so i happened to notice the hard rock doormat inside the door - not hard to find, but as you are up close walking by the building you could miss it.... overall would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, but the service--oh the service!”
Reviews.Author: travelingurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed last month for the tail end of a Chicago area trip. Travelers were my, husband and our 4 year old son. The junior suite we reserved was available with our early check in (unexpected since we were really early). The views from our room were spectacular, day or night! I had expected a full separate room so we could stay up while our child went to sleep. But he was so tuckered out it didn't matter. House keeping brought up a rollaway for his use. The room worked out great for us. The heat in our room wasn't working, but we didn't figure it out until pretty late into the evening. We didn't call it in but I did tell the desk when we checked out. She was apologetic and grateful for the information. I have no doubt they would have fixed it, set things right at that time if we had called for service. The icing on the cake were the bell hops. We were looking for a place to grab a late brunch on a weekday. Both bell hops were so helpful giving the insider's opinions on nearby restaurants. On top of that, they were awesome with my kid. In a swank hotel like this, I expected kids to be a liability. Not the case. They encouraged him to step up to the ping pong table and gave him 5 on the way in and out, they made him (and us) feel totally welcome. The service turned an okay stay into a stellar one. Thanks Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: catchgps
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for stay, centrally located and also very close to restaurants. Staff is very nice and helpful. would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at Chicago Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: SwissMr
Reviews.Content: The Staff makes this a great place stay. Everyone is very "casual polite". No pretense, just sincere courtesy. This is what makes Hard Rock Chicago exceptional. The location is awesome, your will be right on Michigan Avenue, about two blocks north of Millenium Park and approximately 5 blocks to the lakefront. Everything else is what you expect from a property in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Flashy even for a middle aged couple!”
Reviews.Author: MIbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in a King suite at the Hard Rock Chicago. What a fun time and place. The staff was super. Very helpful with information and requests. They were also very friendly. I was worried that I would feel out of place being a mid-western middle aged (gulp) person, but I did not. There are people of all ages and nationalities...The decor is modern and, of course, music focused. I actually took a tour of each floor to check out what muscian was featured on that floor's wall and in the museum case on each floor. I am fairly music minded, but you wouldn't have to be a fan of one genre or another to get enjoyment out of this aspect. Bar smallish, but fun. I never ate in the hotel resturant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with an Addams Family Feel”
Reviews.Author: eagvent
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hard Rock before and it was fine. This is a very nice place with very good service in, for me, a very good location. With my last stay, they raised the bar. I reserved a tower king and was given room 3401. When the elevator opened, the weirdness began. On this floor, the elevator lobby is dark wood paneling with an old, worn out ornate couch under a black glass chandelier. To the right, separated by an open iron gate, was another room, also very weird, again with dark wood paneling and a black glass chandelier, this time under a round table in the middle of a roughly 12x12 foot second lobby. Off of this room, there were 3 doors for guest rooms. The room itself was also dark wood paneling but completely up to par. Two windows looked east out to the lake while another two, one of which was over the bathtub, looked south to the Bears stadium and McCormick Place. Sleep quality is rated only as a 3 as, even being on the 34th floor, there was a lot of street noise, especially from police and ambulance sirens from the station right across Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a wonderful location. The staff made our stay enjoyable. They helped us to find great restaurants. I was very pleasantly surprised by the overall experience. I will definitely stay here when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very clean, very courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan36384
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was a great groupon. We got a really nice price for a great king size room overlooking Michigan Avenue. We spent our anniversary there, and the staff was extremely courteous, and gave us coupons for 2 free drinks in their lounge. The room was very spacious, very clean. One word of caution: DO NOT move anything in the mini bar, you WILL be charged. They do tell you this upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great deal in Chi town”
Reviews.Author: bazinga55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago and we 50+. What is considered a hotel for a younger customer, we found the Hard Rock to be EVERYTHING we wanted in a hotel in Downtown Chicago. Perfect, as we were there for the architectural tours and this building is a beauty. Great rooms, fantastic location, wonderful, helpful staff. Can't sing it's prasies enough. We will visit AGAIN and have told friends to check it out. Not far from the theater district, a nice walk. Near fine restaurants and cheap eats too. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “This place Rocks”
Reviews.Author: nelli9595
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Chicago. Had a great time here and it was well located to check out the city. Very trendy bar in the lobby. The rooms were very nice and well decorated. Very modern and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, buy sheets that fit the bed”
Reviews.Author: jacknkatierock
Reviews.Content: Stayed in hard rock jotel, great hotel, location, bar and cant beat the guitar loaner program. But why cant they buy sheets that fit the bed. Cheap flat sheet on the bottom that was a foot shorter than the bed. So the bottom of the bed is nothing but mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Definitively would come back! Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Arnaud21
Reviews.Content: I went to a Workshop for 3 days and regretted not staying a few more days. The hotel is located right on North Michigan Ave., close within walking distance to most major attractions like the Navy Pier, the Shedd Aquarium, the Planetarium and mostly to the Chicago Museum. All other major restaurants, stores, pizza venues, theaters, etc. are also very close. The check-in process was seamless: expedite, friendly, warm and lively. Yes, these guys were happy and the conveyed the message contagiously. The lobby is ok, not a knockout but it is not pretentious, cluttered ,nor does it stand in the way of many interesting people around. It has a bar in one of the corners that I invite everyone to have a drink at some time while there. The music can be live, background, or from people singing the songs from the band playing. Not Vegas wild but very Chicago nice and fun. I was surprised at the high heeled fun crowd that what there the two nights: friendly and in similar party mood. Bartenders were very nice and not the obnoxious kind found in trendier places. The rooms were super clean, spacious and mine had a nice view in the 22nd floor. I like to spend time in hotel rooms working, reading, and relaxing. Although not too homey, chair, bed and decor made me feel very comfortable. Room service staff was very friendly and helpful. Try the Club Sandwich on wheat bread with Avocado and French Fries. Service from housekeeping was very nice, humble, and extremely helpful. Finally, if you like chinese food and sushi, try the China Grill Resturant at the back of the lobby. The food is excellent, the staff better and the ambiance very very loungey, a nice contrast from the other bar. Try the Kobe Burgers with the most delicious French Fries I've tried in years. Hope I can make it back for vacation. I can be spoiled here without spending a ton. Business travelers, take note!

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BostonAnna2424
Reviews.Content: First time stay at Hard Rock and to Chicago. Great location - less than 5 minute walk to Grant Park, Magnificent Mile, the CAF river tour, the train, and lots of great restaurants and street performers. Fantastic staff from reception to concierge to housekeeping to hotel bar bartenders - friendly, efficient and super helpful. Fun rocker style atmosphere (we stayed on the Jimi Hendrix floor and had some other musician photos and quotes in the room) without being over the top. Room had small extras like steam-free shaving mirror and reading lights attached to bedlamps. I don't know what the usual price is (we got the room on sale for $159/nt), but we'd definitely look to stay here again for the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedic2006
Reviews.Content: We had another amazing stay again at the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago!!! The staff was amazing as always along with the room. A great location with so many amazing restaurants and attractions close by!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Rocks My Visit!”
Reviews.Author: LadyLipstick
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at the Hard Rock. Their staff and friendliness did not disappoint. Their check-in is prompt and friendly. I love access to free WiFi in the rooms. Weather was bad so I used room service which was delish and timely. Rooms are equipped well. Stayed on the Tina Turner Floor. The location is great. My conference was at the Cultural Center just a couple of blocks down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DRoman
Reviews.Content: It's my second time at the Hard Rock Chicago and thought it deserved a review. I really like this hotel. It's in a great location -- plenty of shopping and restaurants around. Most importantly, the staff at the hotel is very welcoming --- they make you feel right at home. On my first trip, I scored the Penthouse suite because there was an issue with my room -- that was a treat. On this trip, I got a regular room but it was still spacious and very comfortable. There was nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Chicago rocks!”
Reviews.Author: josudore
Reviews.Content: Great hotel -- room was very clean, very little noise from the street, comfy bed and excellent location. Also used meeting space here -- it's small, but very nice space and the catering and AV staff were excellent as was the food they served.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, but...noisy rooms, awful beds.”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte28
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write hotel reviews, but felt others needs to know what to expect. We stayed at the Hard Rock Chicago this past weekend while we were there for the Chicago Marathon. Let's start with the pro's- Great location- a few blocks from where the marathon start was, cool theme, nice employees. Con's- First night there we were exhausted from a full day of travel but couldn't sleep a wink, even 14 floors up all you could hear were sirens, car horns and traffic. The rooms were virtually like being on the ground floor with all of the noise. The room was hot the whole time we were there, we would turn down the AC and come back and it was turned back up, couldn't get it cooled off. The beds were not only uncomfortable, but dirty. What I thought was a folded sheet at my feet turned out to be no sheet at all, no mattress pad, just the stained, dirty, mattress. Neither of our beds had real mattress pads (just some weird, dirty thing that didn't cover the whole mattress), or fitted sheets, just a flat sheet that may or may not cover the whole bed... but we didn't realize this until the 2nd night when we actually looked down under the sheets to see what was going on. I called the front desk, told them that we needed to have the bed linens changed, they were polite but didn't act like it was a big deal at all. The housekeeper that came up was very nice and changed both beds. After further inspection we don't think the sheets had been changed in a while. YUCK! We were thoroughly disgusted, so again, no sleep. They didn't even have duvet covers, they just wrap the duvet in 2 flat sheets, not sure how sanitary this is. Needless to say, we couldn't wait to get home to our own bed. On top of them being dirty, they were the most uncomfortable beds we've slept in. We usually stay at Westin hotels, but chose this one due to the location and proximity to the start of the race. Guess we've been spoiled and have grown to expect a "heavenly bed" when we travel. Hard Rock definitely needs to invest in some better beds, and complete sheet sets... I hate to write a bad review so I'll end on a good note, the staff was really nice and helpful, and the hotel is in a really good location near a lot of great attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Double_A_71
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Hard Rock hotel was a nice place to stay. The service was great and I like the Loop location for my Chicago business trips. The hotel isn't huge and the staff was very helpful. I would recommend that travelers request a high floor room, so that you get less noise from the city. I stayed in room 813 which is a corner room and it was nice to have all of the windows, but my room would have been quieter if it was higher. If you are in to rock and roll, you will enjoy the memorabilia. If you play guitar, you will enjoy the guitars that are available on loan from the hotel. We found a deal on Travelzoo for $159 per night, which was a good deal in comparison to our other options. I would stay here again, especially if the price is right, because the hotel is of a reasonable size and the staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “Sept 30-2”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: Great weekend at the "Rock"! Outstanding customer service top to bottom. Clean modern rooms. Kids dug the rock star vibe. Stumped the bellman on the band portrait in room #1207, still thinking early Pogues. Gene Simmons Kiss art in the bathroom. Donâ€™t forget to order up a guitar to hang with in the room (free). *Cons, mother-in-law felt the hallwayâ€™s were far to dark. Different, but definitely dark. No free wi-fi? wi not? Fear not, there were two free computer stations in the lobby. Staff rocked it to an A+ for me.

Reviews.Title: “Rock 'N Roll in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: carrie m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel the weekend of 8/26 for 4 nts. with my 9 yr. old son and loved it. We usually stay at the Four Seasons, Ritz or Park Hyatt but got a great deal ath Hard Rock on Travelzoo for $109/nt.. We had the basic deluxe king room that overlooked Michigan Ave. and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very big, clean, modern, good sized bathrooms and nice bath products and a great location. The bed was very comfortable and there was a nice size desk and flat screen tv. I lived in Chicago for 12 yrs. so know the city well. This location is the best in town-right on the river and Magnificent Mile on Michigan Ave, as well as Grant Park, walking distance to the Acquarium and Soldier Field and Oak Street Beach. Many restaurants around the corner. Didn't eat at the hotel. The staff was very helpful and kind. We come to Chicago once or twice a year and plan on staying here every trip.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' Time at the Hard Rock”
Reviews.Author: jdelor
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago in early Sept for 5 days & this was a great hotel to stay at. It is in the heart of the city with many shopping places & restuarants near by. I was lucky enough to get a room on a high floor with good views. The rooms are large & dark (fitting in with the hotel theme). Very friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to sleep below the 4th floor!”
Reviews.Author: smervin
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Chicago and the Hard Rock was close to my meeting the next day so I decided to give it a try. The building is very interesting, old architecture, with lots of rock material. Each floor is themed to a different group. The room was very modern and clean but the insulation is lacking as I found out later. I didn't notice it at first but the later it became the noise from the lounge was getting louder and louder. I woke up to loud drumming and a pounding bass and thought that I was going to be carted off to a big pot of boiling water. Finally about 1:30 I was just about ready to pack up my room and call downstairs and tell them to get me a room on a higher floor when things began to calm down a bit. If you do decide to stay I would recommend a floor much higher ,10 or above.

Reviews.Title: “Cool theme hotel”
Reviews.Author: hjb4971
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hard Rock during convention in June. Looks fancier than it really is and the price was high for what we received. That said it is conveniently located within walking distance of the Merchandise Mart where we were working each day and there were several good restaurants in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressive and I imagined”
Reviews.Author: ljgf
Reviews.Content: Room with a view on the 12th floor was nice. Just nice.I have stayed at Hard Rock Hotel in Vegas and I don't think the Chicago room matched up. Stayed Wed & Thurs night & after state/city tax the nightly charge was $302.35 plus $46/night valet. Chicago is an expensive Midwest city to visit but I believe a better value could be found in the same area. The desk staff were very accomodating. The China Grill located in the hotel had a good weekday special on drinks & sushi.

Reviews.Title: “More about the name than the stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChriss
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago for a convention. A colleague chose the hotel. The convention room rate was $199/night, which I did not think was worth the value of the hotel. The lobby is hip, like everything related to the Hard Rock. Guitars behind the front desk and music playing in the lobby are expected. The desk staff was friendly, and I was even allowed to check in rather early. My room had two queen beds, a long desk/dresser area and a small refrigerator. The room size was comfortable, although the lighting in general was inadequate in my opinion. I could work at the desk just fine, but otherwise I felt like I was in a cave. The entry area around the closet was very dark. There was a mirror on the wall above the beds' headboards, but it was more decorative than practical. The lighting in the bathroom was also bad, and it was hard to see what I was doing. (My eyesight is very good.) There is a full-length mirror on the closet door, but there is barely any light around it to see yourself in the mirror. While some may view the room decor as having a certain style, I felt that it was just a thin facade. When I returned to the room after a long day, I didn't get that feeling of being somewhere to relax and unwind. It's not that a hotel room has to feel just like home, but this room didn't make me feel like a welcomed guest. The elevators were slow. I had to wait several minutes (up to 10 minutes one time) before a car arrived. Internet access cost $14/day. Wired and wireless was offered, and I used the wired access because the wireless coverage was spotty. The hotel location is good, being on Michigan near Wacker. But overall, I felt the room rate was far from being a reasonable value for the room itself. My stay itself was fine. The staff was helpful. The bed was comfortable. The rock n' roll memorabilia decor throughout the hotel is interesting. But given a choice I would stay somewhere else in Chicago; and in fact I did. I needed to stay two more nights and I booked those nights at the Club Quarters Central Loop for $30/night less (and wireless Internet was free). There's nothing really wrong with the Hard Rock. Perhaps other rooms have better lighting or are more inviting. I could stay here again, but I thought the room rate was comparatively too high and the general feel was not inviting. (CS)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: majigail
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because the hotel hosting the conference I was at was full. I was a little nervous going in that it might be loud or full of rambunctious tourists, boy was I wrong! When I was in my room, the only thing I heard was the occasional siren (I was on the 7th floor). I took the L from the airport and walked the 3 blocks from the closest stop. I only had one bag, so this wasn't bad at all. Unlike the reviewer below, I had no problems with my shower with tub, but the best part was the toiletries! The scented lotion, shampoo, conditioner and shower gel were awesome! The internet was a little steep at $13.50 since I reserved through the conference, I did not get the free internet, which you can get if you go through the hotel's website. There was a wired connection available so I used that to avoid any wifi problems. My only complaint would be that the hallways are really dark, a little creepy since I was travelling alone. Otherwise, this place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Ladeelawyer
Reviews.Content: The location is near to Macy's (Old Marshall Fields), river walk (2 blocks) and Navy Pier/Lake Walk (about a mile). Many amenities in the area including shopping, dining, and sightseeing. The hotel is in the old Union Carbide and Carbon building, and they have kept some of the features inside, giving it an air of a former time. However, the rooms have modern decor and amenities including coffees/teas, toiletries, etc. The only negative on the room was the shower (no tub) had a gladd panel that only covered half the opening with no curtain or door. This meant that one side of you got the nice benefit of warm water while the other side got a nice cool breeze! They could fix this. Our encounters with staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. The only bad thing was that the maid did not come until around 3 pm to do the room even though we had a make up room now sign up all morning. By this time we were done with our out of the hotel activities and were ready for a snooze before dinner. So we spread up the bed ourselves and just had her do the bath, which she did quickly and well. Parking is expensive ($46 valet or $40 self-park per night). Friends found a train station out of the city, parked their car there and took the train in - all for less than $25 total. If you can, this is a good idea to save money.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced average hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrAmazon13
Reviews.Content: Room was average, only worth is because of Groupon.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special”
Reviews.Author: willsjams
Reviews.Content: My husband & I wanted to stay somewhere special (and not too expensive) for our one night in Chicago and found a great price at the Hard Rock.
