The rooms were very stylish and we felt like we were in a much more upscale hotel. We got free wi-fi because we requested it when we reserved the room on-line - otherwhise it is not free. We had also requested a discount upgrade when we reserved, but no rooms were available when we checked in at 1:00. Definitely think it would be worth the price to upgrade to a higher floor with the view of the skyline. On the 10th floor we could see as far as the Marilyn Monroe statue down the street One other thing of note - they had a great Bob Marley night special in the bar and the rum punch at $7 was a steal - my husband on the other hand ordered a Captain & Coke and got socked $11 for a small tub drink. Next time he'll go with the rum punch too! Fun hotel with good staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: AverageJoGrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in downtown Chicago but for our wedding night we didn't want to stay at our apartment so we booked a room at the Hard Rock where the majority of our out-of-town guests were staying. Since several of our guests were staying at the Hard Rock they upgraded us to a suite at the guest room rate (brownie points). The room was very nice, a bit on the small side but that's Chicago and vintage buildings, people! The suite had a fantastic view of the Chicago River and the decor was modern and funky -- just my style. After a long night of celebrating (and dancing) we made our way up to the room only to be greeted by some complimentary beer (Goose Island 312 - more brownie points), midnight snacks (Garrett's popcorn - yum!) and a congratulatory note. Wow. We felt like a million bucks. The location is fantastic and my guests couldn't stop raving about the close proximity to all the "must see" Chicago spots. Seeing as I live here I don't know if I'll ever be back but I can say that I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but would one come back if I can find a great offer again”
Reviews.Author: Sam C
Reviews.Content: I left the hotel with an interesting feeling: While the facilities are good, the room had adequate features and a great design, I didn't feel quite comfortable. The personnel were professional, but not nearly as nice as I would expect them to be; as if they were doing just enough not to be rude, but not enough to be pleasant. And it was across the board, so I guess it has something to do with the hotel policies. Another interesting thing was that I never saw security staff in the five days I stayed there; either security technology is awesome or lacking. Other than that, the hotel is clean, small but nice rooms, business center was efficient. It is housed in a beautiful building that is a landmark on its own right. However, it doesn't have a pool, which is very important for my family. I stayed at this hotel because I got a great rate through hotels dot com; if I went by the regular fares at their website, I would've rather stayed at a better quality hotel in the area, which had the same non-discounted fares as this one. Again, really nice hotel, but not memorable.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! You won't want to leave your room.”
Reviews.Author: 2BMXIN
Reviews.Content: Even with Michigan Avenue calling us from our window, we didn't want to leave. This room was the largest we have stayed in. Beds were SO plush. Robes in the closet to use were fit for a king. The front desk people were jovial and fun and helpful for what we needed. Room service was prompt and good quality. DEFINITELY a $200+ quality room. We stayed in a PLATINUM QUEEN ROOM courtesy of Groupon for $179 and we loved EVERY MINUTE. We have been going downtown on Labor day for 4 years and this is the nicest hotel we have experienced so far (swissotel, four points sheraton, chicagogetawayhostel)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Want To Leave!”
Reviews.Author: Hannah M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a simple weekend away, and because he is a musician, I surprised him with a stay at The Hard Rock. We had an absolute blast and were so relaxed! We planned on sleeping in half of the day, Saturday, but with the amazing 33rd floor view, we woke up at six am and didn't wanna leave the windows! Everyone there was so friendly and so accomodating. When we were preparing to check out of the hotel, we were going to drive our car to another parking garage, as we were under the impression we would have to take our car out of valet @ check out. However, who I believe was the manager of the valet team, was super friendly and informed us that we could leave our car there until 5pm! He was so nice like everyone else there, and neither my boyfriend or myself can wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but if you have an issue, don't ask the front desk for help”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler2005
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by stating that I've stayed at Hard Rocks all over the US. Hard Rock Hotel Chicago is a beautiful hotel, and the rooms do not disappoint. They were able to check me in far before check in time, which was good because I could take my bags directly up to my room instead of leaving them at the front desk for the day. They charge you $13.50/day for internet, but if you book directly with the Hard Rock website, this charge is apparently waived. I gave this property a poor rating because of the facility response to an incident that occurred during my stay. I was woken up by a group of rowdy teenagers at 4 am on my last night staying there. I guess they had multiple rooms because there was loud music, screaming, and doors banging repeatedly. I called the front desk to complain and get them to shut the *ell up, and I was told that someone would be right up. Someone did not arrive until 5:50 am and broke up their little hotel party. I had an early flight home the next morning, and I reported the incident at checkout. The clerk said that they noticed this group of kids in the lobby, but didn't know what floor they were on because no one had called to complain...what bull. After I told him that I had called to complain after being woken up at 4 am, his attitude immediately changed to, "Oh well we always send someone up right away when we get complaints. Sorry." Yea...I walked out of this hotel absolutely FUMING. I understand that this hotel cannot be held responsible for its guests' behavior, however the slow response time to my complaint and the "whatever" attitude from the front desk REALLY got to me.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel in a wonderful location - loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: LikesToTravel333
Reviews.Content: My 17-year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for two nights in July. It was a wonderful place to stay. Each floor showcases a different recording artist - on our floor it was Prince. The room was decorated beautifully and modernly and the bathroom was well equipped with a hair dryer, plush towels, and really nice toiletries. The hotel is in a terrific location in the heart of Chicago, and it's easy to get around on foot or by public transportation - subway, bus, train. We only took a cab once, and that was because we were running late for an appointment. The neighborhood is interesting and vibrant with many restaurants, stores, and places to see nearby. We wanted to go to the Hard Rock Cafe and were surprised to find out it was a mile away from the hotel, so we didn't make it there this time! I'd definitely try to stay at this hotel again if I ever return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sbgabor
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in Chicago! Beautiful views from just about every room, in the heart of the city, great staff, great music, GREAT GREAT GREAT!!! The decor is fun, the rooms are spacious & modern, and the bathrooms are amazing. Be sure to stock up on the RockSpa toiletries, they smell fantastic. The in-house club is a little ridiculous, unless you like over priced drinks and overdressed snooty people. Ditch that scene and head to Green Mill or Double Door for authentic Chicago music venues. If you're new to Chicago, use the concierge desk! The HRH staff is awesome, wish all hotels were this accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place close to everything”
Reviews.Author: RandPIndiana
Reviews.Content: Nice room, near the river, trains, park, theaters, everything. Breakfast is expensive in the hotel's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: bossanne
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect - really, it was! Gracious and helpful lobby staff, clean and wonderfully decorated rooms, prime location for magnificent mile and/or Chicago Blues Festival! Lovely colors, hip, fun and functional furniture! The icing on the cake: pillowcases with embroidered guitars! p.s. don't forget to sign up on hotel website prior to booking, perks include free internet, room upgrades when available, and comp beverage upon arrival.. among other things. Loved hanging out in lobby early early early morning for free coffee, newspapers and access to lobby pc/internet.. Will post pics asap ~ enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TravelCrazyNY
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great jumping off spot, 2 blocks away is the park. Great little palces to eat right on the river, short walk to the river tours etc. Rooms were cool too. We had 3 rooms some were big and some were small, but they weren't classified different.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: Kent M
Reviews.Content: Staff at the Hard Rock was great with all of my requests. The Angels and Kings lounge has great drinks and rockin music. Perfect downtown location! Rooms were very clean with great city views. Room service was awesome. Management at the Hard Rock are on their game!

Reviews.Title: “funky hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: talkingtocactus
Reviews.Content: i wanted to stay in the HR hotel because the building it's in (the carbide & carbon building) is my favourite chicago landmark, i think it's just beautiful. i was initially booked for 2 nights but had to add an extra day to the beginning of the stay at a relatively late stage. although this cost a bit more than the previously booked nights it wasn't too bad and was set up easily and i was put in the same room for the entire stay. there was a slight problem when i returned on my 2nd day to find myself locked out. because the first night had been booked separately their system had got confused and shut me out. but their reception staff were really helpful at sorting this out and within 5 minutes or so i was back in the room with no further problems. the room itself was very cool as you'd expect from the HR chain - big bed, contemporary furnishings, and a big picture of iggy pop on the wall, but it was also really comfortable and well laid out. the room looked directly over michigan avenue which made for a good view, it was fun to sit by the window and just watch the people down below. the bathroom was extremely modern but a good size and had everything you need. the only slight problem as i found it was that the layout made it slightly awkward - for instance the toilet paper roller was on the other side of the room from the toilet, and the door was so close to the bath and toilet that if the bath mat was on the floor it would get all scrunched up and the door would get stuck - sometimes it's the little details that are more annoying than big issues. the only really major problem i had in this hotel was the noise - the doors to the rooms were, i think, metal, and as such were quite noisy. my room was close to the elevators and i could hear literally everything from the hallways. in fact more than once the room next door to mine had visits from housekeeping and i thought housekeeping were knocking on my door as i could hear the knocks so clearly - i'd open the door to them and they'd be waiting for next door. when people took luggage to and from rooms i could hear the suitcases clattering about and anything people were saying to each other. given that some people were leaving for flights quite early in the morning (about 5-6 am) it was quite annoying. maybe the hotel could consider soundproofing their doors a bit more because although they were very contemporary and cool they weren't necessarily practical. that aside, the whole place is extremely cool, the decor is modern, the rock memorabilia is great to look at, and the building itself is just stunning. and the location is amazing, 1 block from the michigan avenue bridge, a few blocks from millennium park, 2 24 hour shops within 1 block - you can't get much better in terms of location. overall i really enjoyed staying there but at times (especially with regards the bathroom layout and doors that allowed so much noise) it felt as though style had come before substance.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms but not family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: tvatravel5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family wedding. While it was very convenient and the rooms were very large, the entire hotel felt dark and cold. We enjoyed the view out our window of the city and also appreciated the walking distance to good shopping and restaurants. But the fact that all five of us - including 3 teenage daughters - had to get to ready for the wedding with one tiny mirror above the sink in the bathroom left us with a dissatisfied opinion of this hotel. After five hot showers and three curling irons/ blow dryers on the tiny sink counter, we had a very difficult time squeezing in to get ready. At one point I even burned my foot so bad after climbing over the cords and knocking one of them off the counter, I could barely wear my shoes to the wedding! The obvious fact that we were a family of five sharing one room, should have alerted the check-in staff to give us an appropriate room. Because we were traveling with family, we were able to see the other rooms, and they did have better rooms. It was just too late to change at that point. My advice to travellers that stay here is make sure you request a good room with ample mirrors/bathrooms! They did do good job of accommodating the wedding, it was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as cheesy as you'd think - very nice in fact”
Reviews.Author: jeremymmason
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that I would not normally choose to stay at a Hard Rock hotel. Not really my thing. That said, I had some meetings on the other side of North Michigan, in the dead of winter, so limiting my walking distance was important, and I gave it a shot. The first room they put me in was very small and dark, and I was not impressed at all. So after complaining, they moved me up into a medium-sized King, and it was very nice. The furniture was pretty new, the wall art had a unique feel (John Lennon motif), the room was quiet, the wi-fi was blazing fast, the bathroom was surprisingly large, and I had a very nice sleep that night. I have stayed a second time, asked for a medium-sized room (which I got), and had another great stay. So all in all, it was a good experience, and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations; but too dark.”
Reviews.Author: drdonaldorb
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights and three days in this hotel and the accommodations were fine. Room was clean, comfortable and employees hospitable. The room and the hallways were too dark for our liking. Probably will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “great family winter getaway!”
Reviews.Author: supermom1975
Reviews.Content: family friendly. easy walk to many attractions. valet your vehicle upon arrival and explore the great city of Chicago. we had such a nice time, we are planning to return to experience the city in a warmer time of year as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, FUN hotel!”
Reviews.Author: b0cam0m
Reviews.Content: If you like rock-n-roll, you'll love this hotel. All sorts of music memorabilia, hotel floors named for different music personalities/groups. Easy walk to Millenium Park, Art Institute, lake shore, Navy Pier, The Loop, shopping on Mag Mile. We booked a platinum two-queen bed, great room layout, clean, large bathroom, comfy beds, safes, excellent closet space. You'll have a "rocking great time" at the Hard Rock in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the name fool you -- solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationer71
Reviews.Content: Hard to see how this hotel benefits from the Hard Rock branding. We found it to be an attractively-priced and nicely-featured business hotel in the heart of Chicago's financial district. Rooms were large and well set up. Breakfast in the restaurant tasty and reasonably priced. Had free lobby and business center computers with free printing (at least for boarding passes). Didn't use the gym or room service.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel in Good Location, but Not Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: GarfieldGill
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel due to its location and amenities; however, it is a little on the expensive side. I travelled to Chicago with some friends. We decided to stay at the Hard Rock Hotel given its proximity to downtown and the Magnificent Mile, and the unique features to the hotel. The hotel is 40 stories tall and the architecutre is in the old art deco style, complete with green terra cotta and black polished granite. The building used to be the old Carbide and Carbon headquarters (now a part of Dow Chemical). The decor in the lobby and rooms certainly have a unique feel to them in that they are music inspired. The atmosphere in the hotel feels more like it is one of Elvis's rooms than a true hotel - and this gives it a special feeling. If you walk out the doors, you're right on Michegan Avenue, close to Millenium Park and the Magnificent Mile. Your location couldn't be better! In summary, I would stay at this hotel again given its unique decor and excellent location. I would be wary of the price and try to book it when it is cheaper. If you found this review helpful, please click "YES"! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ClareS84
Reviews.Content: Chicago was the second city on our 3 month visit of America. Arriving at the hotel, the staff upgraded us to a suite overlooking Willis Tower. We had an incredible 3 night stay at this hotel and the staff went out of their way to help us, suggesting music venues and restaurants which were both fantastic. The hotel is very central which helps when you don't have a car. We would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel- Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: hotelier321
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel Chicago is a beautiful hotel! My hotel room was clean, spacious and very quiet. I stayed multiple nights here while on a work trip and felt right at home! The staff was friendly and attentive, and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Chicago. Also the location was great and very accessible to many restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome-even at full price!”
Reviews.Author: classA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while seeing a play downtown. Booked it only because of the Groupon deal, so the room was about half price. We walked in, expecting the "no such thing as a free lunch" adage to come into play, but...oh...my! Everything we experienced exceeded expectations!...corner room, facing Northeast, so we had a view of the Michigan Ave bridge over the river (with Wrigley Building and Tribune tower), and a sliver of the lake between buildings facing east. The room was big (Super gi-normous by city standards? VERY comfy king bed, little hallway from the hotel corridor by the elevators into the actual bedroom, so noise from people going to/from elevators was low...good sized, bright bathroom. Helpful and nice front desk staff...bellhops....bartenders in Angels and Kings...and the reason we booked it: location. Right by the river, near the lake, not terribly far from the train stations... Only negatives we could find were very slow elevators (tried to take the stairs down one day and got to the bottom floor and the sign said "No exit-go back up to the second floor and take the elevator"--how silly did we feel taking an elevator down 1 floor?), and street noise. We were 8 floors up and I realize my city is loud (yes, we're suburbanites who went into the Big City for a night). I can't say we are complaining about the noise, just seems they could've tried a little harder to block it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: SocialFibers
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel because 1) It's the Hard Rock 2) It looked like it was centrally located and 3) It's the Hard Rock. We were so stoked to see that it was not only centrally located, it was literally perfectly located just two blocks from the "L" train, Millennium Park, one block from the river and a few blocks from Miracle Mile! We couldn't have been happier with the hotel's location in relation to everything Chicago. As far as the hotel, it is a cool looking hotel in a historic building and the lobby bar was pretty nice too. I was a little surprised that there wasn't a larger bar or club in the hotel per my previous experiences with the Hard Rock ( Las Vegas & San Diego). We are definitely staying here again on our next trip back to Chitown!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jenesseOC
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel that's set in the middle of it all. It was very convenient to walk out the door and find great food and drinks and visit the tourist attractions all within minutes. I thought the room decor was clean and modern, nothing over the top, but I had everything I needed, and felt comfortable in it. I had room service for breakfast and the staff was very nice and accommodating, and the breakfast was tasty. I also took advantage of their mini-gym inside the hotel, and though it was small it had the basics to keep your workouts up while traveling, though I didn't really need to since it was 100 degrees outside, and a 5 minute walk left me feeling as if I'd ran a mile. But all in all I thought it was a great hotel to stay at while in Chicago and I'd go back there again as long as I could get another upper level floor room - the view at night is pretty darn cool!

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovemydog_11
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time during our stay at Hard Rock. We celebrated my parents 50th Anniversary and they treated us wonderful. Their was fruit and champagne waiting in my parents room. All of the concierge's helped us out with maps and directions and places to eat and shop. Special thanks to Jason and Scott for all their help.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Princessstringbean
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a 15 year old European girl, I thought this would be a fun atmosphere, but instead I found it to be dark and dreary. The staff acted distracted and not eager to help. E specially be aware the Hard Rock Cafe is not at this location ---- it is several blocks away and the in house restaurant is not particularly family-friendly. in fact the location is probably the biggest drawback. Obviously I share responsibility for not researching better, but the high prices, indifferent staff and oppressive decor didn't help.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta be the best hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: ScreenName700
Reviews.Content: I was in town with a friend for the Pitchfork Music Festival. On the advice of a friend, we booked rooms at the Hard Rock. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. The $104MM renovation this historic Burnham & Burnham skyscraper went through to reach its current state of fabulosity was evident everywhere (yes, I'm an architecture junkie). Great rooms, a terrific nightclub downstairs, and so on. Located just a couple of blocks from an L stop that got us to everywhere from the Festival grounds (3 stops away on the Green Line) to Wrigley Field. Okay, so the physical plant is great, and the location is great, so what about the staff? Very friendly and knowledgeable, but also helpful and efficient. I left a couple of pairs of shorts in the chest of drawers. Shorts with sentimental value (maybe that weird, but whatever), so I called to see if there was some way I could get them back. Turns out Housekeeping had them at hand and mailed them to me that day. You can't beat that for service! Next time you're in Chicago, do yourself a favor and stay at the Hard Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great bar, awesome rooms and bedding, the staff is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel36441
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the 4th of July Taste of Chicago event with family. I booked last minute and upon arriving was greeted by Jason at the front desk whom provided excellent service. The room had a great view and the bedding is amazing. Afterwards, we went to the lounge and had a wonderful time. Again, the staff in the lounge was nothing short of excellent. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “NON SMOKING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: born2hack1973
Reviews.Content: Was very suprised at check-in to hear this hotel is entirely non-smoking. We had booked a 2 night stay here, but left after the first night. The rooms were clean but had several fixtures that were falling off the wall. there were several spots on the walls that had some chipped paint. Very supprised that this hotel was a 4 star hotel. More like a 3 star. I got a kick out of the refrigerator in the room. It was completely stocked with beer, whiskey shots, red bull, figi water, etc. however, you cant fit any of your own things in there. maybe 2 cans of pop total. The noise is also high at this hotel. Horns and sirens until well after dark. We escaped Chicago the next morning and drove west over to Aurora, IL and played at the Hollywood Casino(NON-SMOKING also, but smoking areas on each side of casino) for awhile and then stayed at Baymont Inn a few miles away. They had king size rooms/smoking and they also had a bigger refridgerator that kept our drinks cold. Won't even consider the Hard Rock in Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: justjo30
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great from start to finish...just too short. We arrived in the hotel lobby at 9 am and they accommodated us with an early check-in. We were on the 5th floor (Beatles floor). Bed was comfy, linens and toiletries fine. The Keurig coffee maker is a nice touch. I would have liked to have a few paper "to go" cups w/lids to make coffee and take it along. There was street noise from Michigan Ave. but, not enough to keep us awake at night. Scott the concierge gave us a tourist map and answered all my questions on points of interest. This property is at the perfect location for all the tourist attractions downtown. All the staff we came in contact with were professional and pleasant. We would definitely stay at a Hard Rock Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, but could've been a bit better”
Reviews.Author: saram515
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly. Really cool atmosphere. We casually asked for free wi-fi and we got it with no problem. I had a request for adjoining rooms and they accommodated it. The rooms were clean and stylish. We had a Moby picture in the bedroom and John & Yoko in the bathroom. I also liked the Keurig coffee machine in the rooms. There were some downfalls. One of them was the hot water in the shower. We stayed on the 9th floor and kept going hot & cold. I couldn't really take my time and had to rush. The bathroom sink was clogged. For some reason, we didn't get maid service on one of the days we were there. Also, the valet put a dent in the side of the rental car. Overall, I enjoyed my stay there. We'll be back in Chicago in the Spring and I may come back if I find a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 30th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: galiza23
Reviews.Content: This was by far a wonderful stay. The view of the Chicago River was amazing, and the hotel was clean, chic, and best of all, EVERYONE, and I mean everyone, on staff was extremely friendly, and welcoming. The bar, Angels & Kings, was great; the bartender was funny and really knew his stuff! I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average place”
Reviews.Author: CrazyFoodieGuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is housed in an older building which was quite nice & the location was excellent. However, the rooms were just ok & if it wasn't for the awesome discount we got on the room, probly wouldn't book here again. The bathroom had some issues with the toilet & the walls are also a bit thin. One plus was the concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lulustork
Reviews.Content: We were definately tourists coming into Chicago. We wanted to see it all, and did. The hard rock is close to millenium park, a longer walk to navy pier and the museum district, but not a bad cab fare if you want to be a little lazy. Also right at the end of the magnificent mile. The service was great. We arrived early because we traveled by train. When we tried to check in at 1:00 they said our room was not ready, but they could upgrade us and get us in. This was our first trip to Chicago and our 2nd anniversary. We mentioned this at the front desk and they sent up a bottle of delicious champagne that night! The concierge gave us great recommendations for places to eat and where to see fireworks, which was the most spectacular place we could have found. Cabs were easy to get from here and the bus runs by all day. I recommend going during the Taste of Chicago. It was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Classic hotel but noisy room with no response for request to move.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheRock
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in a 'Deluxe room' ended up being on the 7th floor overlooking the roof of the adjacent building and it's noisy industrial airconditioner. I enquired at reception about shifting rooms and was brushed off and told that is 'Deluxe'. I ended up buying earplugs! Rooms are minimal and simply furnished. Fitess room is very basic and business centre was closed for 'renovation' - the room was empty, no carpet and stripped. Bar/restaurant over the road was excellent and hotel is walking distance to most interests/transport/airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock made our First trip to Chicago Great!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieSyracuseNY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Chicago last weekend to attend my nieces wedding. Out of town guests were blocked in Rooms at the Whitehall. I found a deal with Travelzoo and took advantage of a great weekend promotionla rate at the Hard Rock and I am glad I did. We were welcomed by a nice young man, I believe his nametag said "JP" - who honored my request and found an outstanding room with a magnificent view. Room 2702 in the tower could not have asked for a better view - clear shot of Michagan Ave and so beautiful in the evening. The room was huge, clean and the windows opened! I loved it. Housekeeping was right on top of it with fresh towels, bathrobe, soaps, shampoos.....I could go on. Most importand comfortable feather beds! JP gave us a map and explained everything that we needed to know. The concierge was so helpful as well and friendly. Sunday afternoon as we were leaving a wonderful young lady at the desk took pictures for us and gave us guitars.....felt like a rock star! I didn't get her name because I was so excited....afterwards during the taxi ride to the wedding both my husband and I wished that we tipped her (sorry - caught up in the moment). Didn't have time to try the restaurants. The coffee and the newspaper in the lobby every morning was a nice touch. This is the most friendly hotel that I have ever stayed at. If we go to Chicago again I am absolutely staying here again. (I hope my niece and her husband have a baby soon :) ) This hotel is in walking distance (if you like to walk) to The river walk (must take the architectural boat cruise), Navy Pier, Milennium park (They had a Saturday Zumba class there - so cool!), Grant Park, John Hancock Bldg (gotta have a cocktail at night in the lounge), Oak Street Beach and of course glorius Michagan Ave. Loved Chicago and Loved the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: shuttermother
Reviews.Content: The staff was great! We were celebrating our 10 year anniversary. The hotel sent up champagne and chocolate covered strawberries and free drinks to the bar. We had room service for breakfast every morning, though it was expensive, it was worth it! Room was clean and excellent service! No pool. The restaurant was very good but expensive, portions were small and you left hungry. Lots of restaurants in walking distance and the hotel is close to a lot of attractions and the boat taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nbk5276
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday June 4th, and check in was efficient, a little surprised that the bellhop/doormen did not offer to help with the bags. Our room was on the 18th floor the "Tina Turner" floor. Rooms have an Asian minimalist feel. I normally rate a hotel room on 22 criteria, the bed, which was excellent, minus the lackluster pillows, and the water pressure in the bathroom which was fantastic. Upon arriving in the room we noticed a few items missing from the room or that needed to be replaced. We let the front desk know upon heading out for some sightseeing. I was pleased to see upon return that these had been promptly taken care of. I have 2 minor observations/annoyances from our stay on this trip. First let me preface that the weather was horrifically hot while we were there, 97 degrees. After a long day of running around sightseeing 9 to 4 the last thing one wants is to come back to a room that has not been serviced. Upon asking the front desk, we were dismissively told they had until 6 pm to get this done. The other was observation is with the elevator area of the lobby. Everytime you walked through you felt like you had stepped back into the the 1980's with such an overpowering smell of Drakkar Noir. Sometimes it was so strong I almost started coughing. Would I stay here again? Absolutely!! The location is fantastic! The hotel resides in an historic building but nicely updated with all of the modern conveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay for wifi, ask for free wifi and you'll get it”
Reviews.Author: thame_hoops
Reviews.Content: Booked via hotels.com, nice hotel in a great location, my room was big, big tv, al though when it rains the tv reception stops. Air con worked perfectly, comfy bed, nice working area, big shower. They charge for wifi but just ask at reception for complimentary wifi and they will give you a free password. The maids don't bother to give you shampoo etc when you use your allocation up, you have to chase them in the hallways and ask. I was surprised that the people staying here seemed to be in their 40's and above, I assumed it would be a younger hip crowd? Doormen extremely helpfull, the female reception staff seem a bit 'over the top' I'd stop here again if the rates are ok, I was just expecting somehing more from the hard rock. My floor seemed to be the only one that had worn carpets and doors, no memrobelia in the halls, maybe it's a floor they allocate to the third party travel sites that charge less?

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Treat”
Reviews.Author: HollisGert
Reviews.Content: For our 49th anniversary we made reservations to stay at Hard Rock Hotel on Michigan Ave. We chose it because of its ideal location and the value for under $200. We were able to check in at 7:30 AM without an additional charge. We were on our way to Wrigley Field for a Cubs vs Brewers baseball game. Since we didn't have tickets yet, we needed to be at Wrigley when the box office opened. It was great to get our luggage checked in and then catch the Red Line about three blocks from the hotel on Lake and State. When we returned to our room in the evening we had a lovely bottle of bubbly wine chilling and a delicious assortment of cheese and fruit that had been delivered compliments of the hotel. What a wonderful surprise! This is an ideal location to stay on Michigan Ave. Each floor is designated to a rock star...our floor BB King. A lighted glass case includes a guitar. Also with the reservation a code was given for free download of music. Our luggage was stored for us on the following day until we were ready to leave the city. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler82560
Reviews.Content: Super Hotel - Very friendly and helpful staff.....Easy access to the Red Line & close to the shops & restaurants....

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at It's Best!”
Reviews.Author: PTHILL23
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hard Rock Hotel last night with my wife to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, upon attempting to check-in I was told that I had reserved a room for a later date, you can imagine my shock and dismay at my mistake, but I will say the front desk staff was overly accommodating to help me out. They not only found my wife and I another hotel to stay at, which was right around the corner, but they also reserved the hotel charges I had made with Hotels.com and give us a couple of complimentary drink tickets. They went well and above providing me with incredible service and are definitely a hotel I will stay at in the future. Hard Rock Hotel ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: philsdottir
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just two days as a business meeting I was attending was held in this hotel. It actually wasn't even two days since I arrived one morning and departed maybe 28 hours later. But, it was enough to give me a taste of the Hard Rock Hotel. Appearance/Lobby: The Hard Rock is in a building that once was used for something else, for sure. There are entrances on both streets that it corners. One is the main entrance, and the other is a side entrance where the elevators and the shop are. The lobby is streamlined, spare, but there are plenty of places to sit and wait for people, meet, converse, etc. There is a little lounging area with a couple of computers off the main lobby. Location: The location couldn't be better! I loved that I could walk to Grant Park, get Garrett Popcorn, easy easy access to the El and transportation. All kinds of things around the neighborhood, too - restaurants, bars, shops. Services/amenities: Great services. Any question I had, the staff had an answer for, and a friendly one at that. They lent me an umbrella when I needed to walk somewhere in the rain. They knew the area, knew the best places to go, were handy with a map, etc. Free wifi in the rooms (they give you an access card), great concierge service. There are a couple of computers in the lobby so you can check email etc. while you wait for people, without having to go to a business center. I really like the 'try a guitar' service, too - there is a menu with electric and acoustic guitars and you can choose one (free!) and it will be yours in your room, for the duration of your stay. There are lessons too, but they aren't free, I don't think, and I wasn't there long enough to try them. Just don't break it or you could be out lots of money - these babies are valuable! I'm told there's a gym but I wasn't there long enough to use it or even check it out. There is a shop with lots of stuff in it, it's not cheap! Rooms: Not enormous, but plenty of space for me. I had a king bed, which provided a fantastic sleep! There is a room safe, a flat screen with the requisite dozens of channels (but I didn't watch TV the entire time I was there). Each floor has a name, and I was on the Elvis floor. There were costumes and guitars of Elvis throughout the floor, and you could go on the other floors and see museum-style displays of the others. I didn't check them all out but I did see the Madonna Floor. There was a chair, and a very long "desk" - sort of a combination of table and desk that spanned the sleeping area. The shampoo, conditioner, soap and shower gel were all great - they use a good provider of these things. The ironing board I wasn't thrilled with - someone mentioned this in a previous post and I kind of shrugged it off, but it turns out they were right. Very thin cover and you can feel the bars/grates through it, and when you iron your garment takes on the pattern of the ironing board grating because the cover isn't thick enough. This is the only negative I can think of in my stay, though. Food and Drink: There was a restaurant that looked nice and I was planning to try it but ended up going out with colleagues - that good access to everything again! Before dinner and after, we had drinks in the bar, which was pretty good. It got really crowded and there was live music, which was great. The drinks were pretty good, although not the most consistent - I had one Bloody Mary that was so nasty I couldn't even drink it, not sure what on earth they put in that, but it was not like the previous few! The live music (also free) was a great touch - it was like being in a club, at a destination, but without the snootiness and it was free and I didn't have to go anywhere for it! Conference services: I didn't plan the conference so I can't speak to the ease of organizing anything, but there were a number of rooms on the conference floor, and it seemed that the room was an excellent size for the participants, it was set up well, etc.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: aestho-nomics
Reviews.Content: i have always liked music themed places, so this was definitely something i'd planned to do at some point. the hotel was good, the service was fine, just that there is nothing very special about the regular city view rooms as all the fancy things are all reserved for the suites etc. nonetheless, great weekend, would love to be back!

Reviews.Title: “EXTREME”
Reviews.Author: baludwiguwm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Extreme Suite for one night while I was staying downtown with friends. The room had just been remodeled, so most everything in there was brand new. I will say the photos online when I booked showed the room having a dining table, but instead they got rid of that and replaced it with a pool table and a tabletop arcade with Ms. Pacman, Galaga, Asteroid, Donkey Kong, etc. We really enjoyed the complimentary arcade games, and they even brought us up a poker table top for the pool table, and some chairs so we could play cards. All and all they did a great job of taking care of us, and everyone was excited to hang out in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and a good value”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here about 10 times for business and I find it to be consistent and relatively inexpensive. It is also a very convenient location for exploring downtown. It's not a four or five star place obviously, but is a good choice if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Joevarg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights while attending a professional meeting. Got a corner room on the 18th floor. Grrrreat views all around. The room size was much larger than expected; even with two queen beds there was plenty of space. The beds were comfortable and everything was expected. Had booked the hotel through a travel site, and the deal we got was worth it. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has just been renovated. The carpets in the hallway outside the room were replaced while we were there; we were warned about it on check-in; and they did it with a minimum of fuss and disturbance.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: D_Mcouple
Reviews.Content: We Love the HARD ROCK HOTEL!!!!! I just can't say enough about our stay at the Hard Rock! I have never before had such 'individualized service'! If that is what you're striving for you have certainly surpassed our expectations! We'll fill out any survey and every survey highlighting Hard Rock as the place to stay :) We have been telling everyone about our Oprah Adventure and speak just as enthuasistically about our Hard Rock Adventure! I cannot tell you what it meant to us to have been given such special treatment! It truly enhanced an already perfect trip to your fine city! Each staff member was warm, exciting, engaging, helpful, and eager! We have been to Florida, Scotland, Cuba, Jamacia, and all over Canada...and have never before received such personalized service! Jamon was amazing and I hope this message reaches his boss...I'm happy to forward something personally. We love Jamon! Everyone was great...who else can I tell? :D Thanks to the staff of Hard Rock for making everything so extra special...extra extra special. We wish we could stay with you for every adventure! We will be telling everyone...and have already started...about the amazing service...much more than service...hospitality! <3 to Terra, Jamon...and the entire team!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Haven17
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the smallest double room available at the Hard Rock. The hotel was fine, nothing special. The public areas are definitely nicer than the rooms. The staff was very nice and helpful in person. They twice misquoted prices over the phone for--once we were told an extra cot costs $15 (it actually cost $25), and on another phone call we were told it costs $30 to use the valet and park overnight (it actually cost $46). I'm not sure what was going on there with the incorrect price quotes, and when we told them in person that we were misinformed over the phone they just stared back at us. That was a bit strange. Both bedside lamps did not work when we arrived in the room, but an employee was sent up immediately to replace the bulbs, so that was an impressive response. We were also granted a late check-out without any hassle, as well. (Although, the "front desk" button on our phone somehow went directly to housekeeping, and they were a bit rude and obviously irritated that we reached them both times that we made a call from the room.) The walls in this hotel are very thin, we were woken by a screaming baby at 5:30 in the morning, and heard those wails for the next several hours. We could also hear everyone's conversations as they passed our room in the hall. We didn't mind as we weren't there for a relaxing weekend, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel for anyone who wants peace and quiet. You can hear everything going on around you. We were pleasantly surprised to receive a code good for 10 free iTunes downloads upon checkout. The total cost was just over $250 for one night which seems a bit high for such an average room. If the price matched the room better I would have given this hotel a higher rating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: daddyjay
Reviews.Content: While at a conference in Chicago, I had the pleasure of staying at the Hard Rock Hotel on Michigan Ave. Had a Wonderful experience! Prime location!!! The Staff was extremely helpful in pointing out local sites, events, food, etc. Food served in the restaurant was excellent! I would recommend it for those who more than a conventional hotel, room while in the downtown Chicago area! Great themes in the rooms, lobby, and each floor had its own identity with authentic paraphenalia from celebrities!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: migrant10
Reviews.Content: essentially a "no frills" hotel, despite the name and reputaion. Room was good-very spacious, bed confortable, great service and excellent locale. We were in the 'tower", fllor 32 with a nice view of the city. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and superb location - will visit again”
Reviews.Author: jtga6
Reviews.Content: Our friends chose this hotel after a lot of web research - there were some mixed reviews, but we were all delighted with our rooms, the service and the breakfast. The location is fantastic, close to all the main attractions. The staff were great at reception, the concierge and in the restaurant - the only criticism was with the bar staff - mind you there were busy the night we used the bar (but knowing some basic drinks and passing something else off was poor as was the replacement drink - hey but I guess it could be our British accent). There is free wifi in the lobby area and two free computers - so well sorted for keeping 'connected'

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room, clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mcwilli1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a girls weekend in Chicago and had a great stay at the Hard Rock! Great location, clean big room, great view of the city! The service was impeccable!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: persephone215
Reviews.Content: overall, the hotel is pretty nice. however, it is WAY overpriced. the food in the restaurant was average at best and unbelievably expensive. my husband and i ate breakfast one morning and just for the 2 of us, it was $40. we both had eggs, bacon and potatoes. RIDICULOUS. they had the worst coffee i have ever tasted in my life, hands down. the room was nice and clean, but BEWARE THE REFRIGERATOR!!! they have sensors in them, so if you so much as MOVE a drink, your card on file will automatically get charged. we read the sign (after picking up and inspecting the wine and liquor selections!) that stated you would be charged automatically, even if you don't drink the stuff. just for taking it out of the fridge!!! keep in mind, the vodka was $35 and the size of a can of Coke, so we were charged for it. thankfully, we had a "discussion" with the people downstairs and they took it off of our bill, since we could prove we didn't drink it. it was just frustrating. the hotel was just average, but NOT WORTH THE MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock, It's Hard to Say Exactly”
Reviews.Author: BeMySamaritan
Reviews.Content: While there is nothing wrong with this hotel, the location/service/cleanliness/comfort are all very good, the hotel lacks what you'd find at other fine hotels in the same area. The rooms are spacious but the decor is dark and bland, and the lighting in the rooms is dim (to say the least). The carpet in the hallways is old and stained. Furniture appears old. This is not the same as the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal Studios, so for that I was disappointed. But the price was great and the service was great too. I suppose the bar/club is good too but I didn't visit it. I stayed in the Tower at the very top of the hotel. That was interesting because the tower itself is rather narrow. There are only 3 actual hotel rooms on each floor. It was a little creepy. But the view was fantastic. Would I return? It's hard to say!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing product & service”
Reviews.Author: Bovi33
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to Arron Reynolds, Juan Kirkman and the rest of the staff at the Hard Rock. Great, spacious room - on point service & great bar! Of course we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “An amazing gem for the business and leisure traveller”
Reviews.Author: yvrgirlToronto
Reviews.Content: Most people don't know how amazing the Hard Rock is when you mention it to them because they think of the restaurant and that maybe it's inhabited by crazy rockers! Better for those in the know then - to expect a large room, clean and spacious bathroom with delicious Sweetgrass smelling amenities, an excellent free business centre, and a location that can't be beat. I scored this great deal on Travelzoo $109 which included an upgrade (that I didn't have to mention at check-in - they were THAT good!). The lobby is not that breathtaking (like the Palmer House Hilton that I happened to walk into) - but the Hard Rock room is better (as per my friend who stayed at the Hilton). I had a 21st floor room, corner, that was renovated. It had everything I needed including a safe, 40 inch flat screen, and the most comfortable King bed I have ever slept in!!! Better than a Westin Heavenly Bed. No wonder I heard Kim Kardashian stole a Hard Rock pillow! I did not hear anyone making noise in their room - only once when some partiers were making noise in the hallway returning to their room. The only thing if I had to say is that the corridors and carpets there need to be updated (which they probably are in the process of doing) as there is significant wear and tear. And it was a little disturbing to me to have Moby (?) winking at me the whole time (it was the photo in the room). Rolling Stones magazine is also provided. Also, the conciege were very nice to me, providing me with shopping discounts. And the front desk people are SO helpful and friendly. I can't say enough good things about them. Finally, the location is great. Shopping and sites are within walking distance! Make sure you check the CHicago bureau of tourism website for printable coupons - especially for the Wendella boat architectural tour. PS, this hotel is in the superb Carbide and Carbon building - the only one in chicago with a gold roof!!!! You will love it here. PS I am a young fun professional in my young 30s.

Reviews.Title: “They just don't get it....”
Reviews.Author: tdstyles
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel 2 times a year for the past 4 years. I think this past stay will sadly be my last. The hotel itself is fine and the recent renovations helped out a ton. The carpets used to be filthy and the walls were not much better. Now they are looking much more in line with what you would expect from a hotel of this class. That's really what it comes down to, class. When I stay at what aspires to be a 4 star hotel I have higher expectations than I do when I stay at a Hilton Garden Inn. This hotel has failed me as a guest several times. Here are some low lights from this past stay: -Mold in the bathroom. I stayed in room 603 and there was black mold and mildew on the tiles in the shower. It was in plain sight and is probably still there. Was it running wild and dripping from the ceiling? No, of course not but it was there and it shouldn't have been. Did I bring this to the front desk's attention? At a hotel like this should I have to? -The cover for the ironing board looked like it had been there since the hotel opened. Again, is this a huge deal, no but come on! You spend thousands upgrading each of these rooms and you don' think to replace the cover on the ironing boards. Also when you when you iron a shirt on a board with a worn out cove the grate lines from the ironing board start showing up on your shirt. -The sheets for the bed were like cardboard. Seemed clean but felt cheap. -The coup de gras! No hot water for my morning shower. We got a notice that they would be working on the pipes and our water would be off from 2:00am-3:00am. I woke up at 7:00am and went to take a shower...no hot water. I did call about this one. The front desk staff informed me that "they had been getting calls all morning" and apparently something went wrong with a valve. This was understandable, but not necessarily forgivable since a clean bed and hot shower are the basic pillars of any hotel stay. The cold shower did not make me a happy camper. Let's fast forward to checkout. I go down and the lobby is empty and there is no other guest in line or at the desk. There are 3 people behind the desk including the manager. I tell them I'm checking out of 603. Without a hello or how ya doin they hand over my bill. Here ya go anything else I can help you with? Hmmm, how about asking me how my stay was? Since when is it not common practice to ask how your stay was? ( I guess when you know that the response will be anything but flattering you avoid the question) Am I expecting some sort of retribution from the hotel? Of course I am! They didn't provide me with the stay that they promised so they should give me something back. Did I raise hell to get that something? No, again should I have to? did they even care? No they didn't. While I'm sure they will pretend to now, it's a little too late for that. While I'm sure i'll get some response now that I posted this about how sorry they are about the less than stellar experience I had and they assure me this is not the norm and they will look into this, and blah, blah , blah, but will anything change?...no it won't. How do I know? Experience with this property. Things are not any better under the eye of the new front office manager than they were under the old one. My advice would be to choose the Ritz, Peninsula, Trump, Four Season's or Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “It was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: JenLovesToVacation
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time to Chicago for St. Patrick's day weekend. (about 7th overall). Never stayed here before but always wanted to. Got a great rate and was surprised how nice it was. We stayed on a floor that was just recently renovated. It was very clean and spacious. The hotel itself is conventent to everything. I think the only thing I was a little dispointed in was the lobby bar. It was nice, but very smaill. If you don't get there early, you will not get a seat. But there are many bars very close that you can go to for a night cap. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel rules!”
Reviews.Author: SpikeUK82
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel set in wonderful, historic building with great staff and access to down-town Chi. Reception staff were spot on & friendly at all times of the day; Katie Axi Rose was particularly helpful and of great assistance to my wife & I It's set in an ideal location with immediate access to 95% of all the tourist-type stuff we wanted to do in Chi. We were disappointed that there was no hard rock cafe on site and that breakfast was not included in the price but otherwise have nothing negative to say Our room on 18th floor was very modern with a good view of the river & bridge...it was very clean and had all the mod cons including HD flatsscreen TV!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Impressed - I'd return!”
Reviews.Author: Digital_D
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel, during mid march - As a 4 Star/Diamond hotel, with a fairly touristy brand above the door I didn't set my exceptions too high - Decor and web pics led me to expect something that looked a bit a W but I wasn't too sure... Needless to say when I arrived to the friendly and efficient front desk I was immediately impressed, we where allocated a really good corner room, loads of light, and a view to the edge of millennium park. Nice! Location was excellent, a short walk got you on the L, across to the Magnificent Mile and we where never stuck to get anywhere on the hit list. Bed was really comfortable and I got great sleep, despite the city location, rooms where very quiet. All the staff we had face to face contact with where really friendly and efficient However the hotel loses points because the rooms are beginning to show a bit too much wear, and housekeeping standards really seemed to let the hotel down, with standards varying from day to day. The number of towels left, wether or not amenities where replenished etc. seemed to vary with the day. we where on one occasion left without toilet roll, and on another day our room was not serviced at all, this is really poor for a hotel of this standard, however a quick call got these issues resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value - fun for all”
Reviews.Author: dp_2000NewYork
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock managed to please both me and my 18 yr old son. Great music, great vibe in the lobby and the room was "cool". (I thought it was a bit stark.) The shower has the best water pressure - and big enough for tall adults. The walls were soundproofed so you never heard your neighbors - I did sometimes hear people in the hallways. The location is incredible - a few blocks from lots of public transportation, walking distance to many, many restaurants and blues clubs. Not to mention shopping. The one downer - the biz center is unstaffed on the weekends and no one could fix a printer problem. The fitness room was pretty good. I got a GREAT deal on expedia and then got upgraded by the front desk. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: 445club
Reviews.Content: I am business traveler and stay in quite a lot of hotels. Cleanliness and service are what is important to me. On both scales I would rate the Hard Rock as quite poor. When checking in there was only one person at the registration desk and we was overwhelmed because not only did he have people registering but he repeatedly had to answer the phone to deal with guests. There was a sign at the desk highlighting the hotel's remodeled rooms, I asked the person registering if it was possible to get one on the remodeled rooms. The registrar said he would see what he could do. Needless to say the registration process was interrupted by several phone calls. ( I had booked the room because I colleague had selected the hotel so I wanted to be in the same hotel as him. I was booked for an upgraded room. ) The room I received was not remodeled. I understand that he may not have been able to accommodate my request, but it would have been nice if he had told me rather than ignoring my requests. When I stepped off the elevator, the floors are painted in dark colors giving a dank and dungeon like feel which is amplified by very little lighting. The darkness, however, could not hide the carpet mottled with stains. Entering my room things were little different than the hallway. The Carpet is dotted with stains throughout the room and fraying in several places. The walls and furniture are marked up and chipped. There is a small standing wardrobe tucked in an alcove instead of a closet which barely fits two suits and an overcoat. There are two small drawers for clothes. Overall the room is average size but is in very poor condition. Given the state of the carpet, I was happy to have my own slippers because of the filthy carpet but also because no slopers were provided. No robe was provided so I had to call to get a robe sent up. For people use to nice down comforters, there is a comforter on the bed but it is pile filled and quite dated looking. the rooms look and feel dirty which makes any stay feel unpleasant. I used the fitness center. It also is tired and dated. Some equipment seemed to not function properly. They had plenty of towels but oddly the had earphone cover pads but no headsets. Itis in the basement and the motif is dark with a dungeon like feel. As to the service this confirmed my belief that financially the hotel is having difficulty. The service quality is terrible and the hotel is operating with minimal staff. I had a hint of this when I checked in and my assumption was confirmed throughout the stay. When I called room service no one picked up the phone. I tried again allowing it to ring for many minutes. No one picked up. I called the front desk and was told someone from room service would call me back. After waiting, I called room service again finally someone answered. Another example of poor service was that I had to request twice to have a package that was sent to me delivered to my room. The next day after a day of meetings I returned to my room at 4:00 and discovered that my room was still not cleaned. A minute after I entered the room, I hear a knock. I expected the maid, but rather I was greeted by the person checking the minibar. Clearly filling the minibar is more important than cleaning the rooms. I asked if he could send someone to clean the room. He assured me they would, but of course after waiting I had to call housekeeping to get a maid sent up. The service quality of the hotel is poor and indicative of a hotel that is understaffed. My guess is that the Hard Rock is having financial difficulties. It may be confined to this property but the condition of the hotel and the poor service indicate to me that they are cutting corners. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & restaurant. Beware, Angels & Kings is a joke though!”
Reviews.Author: jean2121
Reviews.Content: I had a great time. The employees were courtious, the room was very nice. We had dinner at the China Grill and it well exceeded our expectations, and was amazing. However, I would like to mention one dissapointing aspect, and that was Angels and Kings. We and other guests agreed that the bar was extremely over-hyped and made out to be much more than it really is... a tiny & average hotel bar with better than average decorating, with seating for 20 max. The descriptions via the Hardrock website and around the hotel itself left much to be desired once we actually entered the bar. In so many words it amounted to blatanly false advertising. Maybe if you gave a more realistic description future guests won't be left dissapointed, as we and others were.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, fun, hip hotel attracts party crowd”
Reviews.Author: yogimomma
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a hip, Vegas vibe. Nice location; just south of the Wrigley Building on Michigan Ave. Nice, easy walk all the way to 900 North Mich. Very sleek, large,modern rooms ( slate grey, white with shock of orange color scheme). We stayed on Annie Lennox floor in renovated room. The reason for the 3 rating was because I coudnt sleep b/c of the noise. We could hear partying, laughing and shouting near the elevator all night through the wee hours. Would not bring my girls here. Bring ear plugs or if you're a night owl, you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait 'til our anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Mlabar
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about our fabulous stay at the Hard Rock. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the doorman, we were treated like rock royalty. We were on our honeymoon, and the front desk staff made sure we got a great corner room. Our views of the city were fabulous! When we ordered room service, and one little thing (the toppings on a burger--no big deal) was left behind, they more than made up for with an immediate replacement and a big fruit plate. Oh, and the food was delicious! A little while later, we were treated to a bottle of champagne! Everyone on the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was always clean and comfy. My husband particularly enjoyed the use of a Les Paul Goldtop for the stay. There is something amazing about the combination of art deco architecture and modern sleek style of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel on edge of Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: soonergirl23
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 2 friends to Chicago to see Bon Jovi in concert. We stayed at the HRH Chicago for 2 nights in a standard room. The hotel bar is very chic and fun. It was packed every night. The bartending staff was friendly and worked hard. The valets were friendly, fun, and helpful as well. The room was clean. The hotel is on the edge of the Magnificient Mile, which is packed with great shopping and great food. We shopped for 2 days. All of the stores are within walking distance. There was two negatives. First, tthe television picture and the television sound did not coordinate. That was irritating but not a big deal. The other negative to our stay was the clerk at check-in. She was not friendly or very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, loud neighbors”
Reviews.Author: Hairtux
Reviews.Content: I stayed for only one night - Sunday night - for a conference on Monday. I had a single bed room which was quite nice. The staff were nice upon arrival and the room was quite clean, and had a decent view. I was very happy to discover that the speed of the in room internet, both wireless and wired, was extremely fast. Most hotels have terrible internet speeds for the rooms so, as a business traveler, it was nice to be able to use the hotel's connection instead of a 3G card. The only negative was that, around midnight or so, the people in the next room started blasting Eminem so the bass was annoying when trying to sleep. I was about to bang on the wall but just before I did, I heard loud cries of pleasure through said wall. I guess it is true - Eminem is good music to bang to. This calmed me down for whatever reason, so I tossed in some ear buds and fell asleep to Stephen Marley. The beds are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is.....”
Reviews.Author: MadforMadison
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!!!!!! I will return and I can't wait! The staff is out of this world and the hotel itself is totally awesome! I recommend visiting each floor to look at the memorabilia. Check out Kings and Angels nightclub! Awesome! A true gem in the heart of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: dpriddy84
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to a Hard Rock Hotel. We stayed two nights just for a short weekend get-a-way and had a blast! The hotel is awesome! The decor is very contemporary and the hotel lounge was cool, trendy, and busy. We had a corner room overlooking Michigan Avenue on the 20th or so floor... WOW! The room was very spacious with plenty of storage (I like to unpack no matter how long I am staying). Being downtown, the hotel is walking distance to everything we wanted to do (shopping mostly), but even if its not, there are cabs on the curb and the "L" is very close by. Overall a great stay at an awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nothing else like it”
Reviews.Author: bighurt56
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hard Rock in Chicago is always a great experience. The location just south of the river on Michigan Ave. offers excellent views no matter what side of the hotel your room is on. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and service that is fast and friendly make this the place to stay in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel Chicago: I'll be Back”
Reviews.Author: WhiskyPhil
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Hard Rock in mid-December for a holiday shopping trip with my girlfriend and was blown away by everything. The staff was incredibly kind and knowledgeable, the hotel was very cool but low key and the beds were insanely comfortable. I will definitely visit the Hard Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever”
Reviews.Author: bszweda
Reviews.Content: The beds in this place were the most comfortable of any hotel I have ever stayed in. Good view from 22nd flr of city - Chicago Tribune Bldg.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ANCY65441
Reviews.Content: Hotel right in the Middle of Magnificent mile, close to all shops and attractions, rooms are modern and clean, a bit tight for the king size suite but over all a great experience. Make sure to not open the mini bar if you are not going to consume anything, it is extra sensitive and will charge you for the item if you touch it, you can always let them know at checkout but if you don't you will be charged so be aware! Bar is small but very nice, great atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic pricey getaway”
Reviews.Author: Creditcardtraveler
Reviews.Content: It was a great deal found at last minute on a hotel search website. I ordered a (surprise) martini delivery to the room when we arrived. It came on a separate bill as requested, and no one ever knew how much I spent on the make-your-own martinis! Room was very creatively decorated, theme of music throughout. Great art, great chairs, desk, everything. I would go back there when I can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “Gave away our room...”
Reviews.Author: chibears12
Reviews.Content: My family made reservations at the Hard Rock Hotel a few weeks in advance for two nights (January 15th and 16th). When we arrived at the hotel the woman at the desk informed us that our room wasnt available for our first night. Apparantly the family who was in our room decided they wanted to stay an extra night, and no other rooms with 2 queen beds were available so we would have to have 1 king bed and a roll away bed. We didnt understand how the other family was able to take our room when we had reservations. The managers excuse was something along the lines of "We asked them if they wanted to move, but they didnt want to." The staff didnt seem to care about my family or what we had to say about the matter. We were given a choice of a downgraded room or to cancel. So we canceled. Even if you have reservations at this hotel you are NOT guaranteed a room!

Reviews.Title: “Moderate Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: owens31187
Reviews.Content: this hotel was average. We got the deluxe king room and it was nice in decor and I enjoyed the dim lighting. The tv was nice. The bathroom was average. no bathtub and the shower was one of those with no curtain or door, it just had a glass wall that blocked the shower head but was still great. Bed was average, not the best ive slept in but still comfortable. Overall it felt like a normal hotel. Nothing too fancy or great about it. you can get a room at the Fairmont for the same price and those rooms are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Luck Motel would be a more appropriate name”
Reviews.Author: Tratravlinman
Reviews.Content: This hotel has just been a disappointment from check in until check out. The staff isn't helpful and on most subjects appears to have no idea about anything in Chicago. Any question to the concierge staff seems to be answered by google instead of local insight. The lobby is dingy, dark, and hopelessly understaffed. Upon check in we discovered a dirty toilet, no toilet paper, and an unemptied trash can. The location also stinks b/c this place is blocks away from the other "magnificent mile" hotels. This is an overpriced Motel 8. It's dark, including in the rooms, smells funny, dirty, overpriced, loud, and inconvenient to almost everything. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Chicago Rocked Out Loud!!!”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedic2006
Reviews.Content: I recently met my partner in Chicago for short 2 day getaway vacation. My partner had arrived in Chicago a few days before me. This was his first visit to Chicago and my first visit in about 10 years. We chose the Hard Rock due to its location and reputation. When I arrived in Chicago, this hotel was conveniently located near Union Station (train station), only about 5 blocks. The hotel is very close to the Hancock building, Millenium Park with ice skating, Navy Pier, and not far from Halstead Street. My partner was ecstatic with the hotel even before I arrived. We stated in a Tower King Suite that was a GREAT room. I loved the open shower, the great bed linens that were available for sale in the gift shop, toiletries, and a spectacular view. The Base Bar in the hotel had an very helpful and friendly staff who were actually first to greet me. The desk staff was very helpful as well especially a very nice young lady named Maria aka Mar. I know that we will be returning to Chicago and we will definitely be staying at this wonderful hotel!!! Oh and take advantage of the in-room massage service if you have a chance.

Reviews.Title: “More of a novelty than a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lojo34
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed in the Hard Rock Hotel last summer. The draw for us was the historic building and the convenient location. We actually got a great deal online for a holiday weekend, which really surprised me. The hotel was fine. We didnâ€™t have any trouble with the staff. We were able to check in early since we had an early morning flight and we were able to â€œcheckâ€� our bags with the concierge while we went to the Cubs game on the day we checked out. Our room was small, but not as small as some we have stayed in Europe. We had a tiny little view of the river, but a great view of the Trump Tower. Ha! We found our room to be clean and our stay to be satisfying, but not extraordinary. Iâ€™m not sure exactly what I expected, but I guess I would have to admit that I was slightly disappointed. For me, it was just an average hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not so kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: msditty
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed "posh" or swanky. It was nice and clean but not kid friendly. There isn't a pool or hot tub and the rooms are small. Which, small rooms are typical in Chicago I suppose. The staff was very helpful, however, we went to check in at 3p and our room wasn't available. I left my diamond necklace in the room after check out and the housekeeping staff did mail it back to me which was a good surprise and kudos for honesty! If you want to be in the heart of magnificant mile, this isn't the location. You really want to be up at least 3 block north. If no other hotel was available I would stay here again but not w/ my teenage boys.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but staff not so friendly”
Reviews.Author: lady_britts
Reviews.Content: After a very long journey into Chicago the day before Thanksgiving, taking 3 hours to drive 10 miles into the city - we eventually found the Hard Rock Hotel. Finding it wasn't easy but very much worth it. Pulling up outside, the valet parking is wonderful but expensive at $49 a night. Buth the inside of the hotel was amazing but then there were the staff who were a tad standoffish. But the hotel is full of so much memorabilia that you can't help but marvel in your surroundings. On every floor, there is something from another band. The room was huge with a gorgeous bathroom on the 9th floor of a possible 30. But everything in the hotel was extra, including the WiFi in the room. However, there was a brilliant business centre on the 3rd floor where the internet was free at all times. And there were 2 computers that were free in the reception area. The hotel was in a great position in the centre of Chicago. Great for shopping & eating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and service!”
Reviews.Author: jballtraveler
Reviews.Content: From the time we booked our hotel room, to the time we left, we were impressed. I have nothing but good things to say about the staff at the front desk, the concierge counter, and our stay. We were upgraded to a larger corner room upon check-in even though we purchased our hotel stay thru a travel site and got a deal on the room. We couldn't believe the room for what we paid, it was great. The service was great, they provided us with an early check in, a late check out, directions to pizzerias, and even brought a DVD player up to our room and hooked it up while we were out shopping. The Base bar was a great place for a drink and to just relax, great service and music. They really made us feel like rock stars. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stepping555
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Room for improvement for some of the staff members at the front desk, qust service was great, room was very small felt like I was in a match box with a lucky strike city view for a upgrade from a standard king to double city view,and floor was stained and dirty. Love the hotel itself would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn42
Reviews.Content: I got very good rate for two nights on Priceline's Name Your Own Price. Always a gamble, but I was not disappointed. Clean, modern decor with two large windows facing north, so I had partial view of the river. Check-in was efficient. Had requested foam pillows and that had been taken care of. Quiet room. Just a few blocks from "L" station from airport. Easy walk to anything in Loop area. Flat screen TV, but remote was slow. Business center had two computers with free internet, so I could check e-mail and print boarding pass. Staff was courteous and professional. Didn't see any rockers, mosly businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Armed_Businessman
