Reviews.Content: IMHO, it was just a little bit above par... Staff is exceptional. GL finding somewhere to dine that is near-by, other that fast-food..

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Hard Rock Hotel - a little pricy for just a room”
Reviews.Author: Rbert282
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel (downtown Chicago) for 5 days in June this past Summer. Although the location was ideal, dowtown and on a central location it surprised me how difficult it took to reach the hotel by public transportation from the airport. The rooms were ridiculously small. (So be forewarned). The linens, towels and pillows were nice but nothing fancy. Keep in mind there wasn't really a place to eat just a bar you could order "bar type food". The employees were fantastic! (Except when your room key has been de-activated and the room is under your spouse. I had to wait two hours my my husband to get out of a meeting for him to personally show identification and to get me another room key) Overall this was a nice hotel but, again for the price we paid you would think you would get a little more. The Hard Rock Cafe was more than a few blocks away if you wanted to use your hotel discount. Great hotel if you are tourist and looking for a trendy place. We heard first response vehicles every night. Just in case you are wanting a quiet night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “First Class...”
Reviews.Author: junuchong
Reviews.Content: From the front office, to the back office...I was treated with the utmost professionalism and class by the staff at the Hard Rock. The service from the front desk was very helpful, and the concierge was great with digging up great spots for night life. The bar in the lobby was great, and the amenities were so nice. Great room, nice beds...beautiful view. Honestly, the Hard Rock is an institution. After staying there...I can see why. Everything is top of the line, including their service. Looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Traveller3121
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hard Rock Hotel on Hot Wire as a mystery hotel - so we did not know the name of the hotel when we booked and paid for room. The room rate was very good; but I would not pay the advertised room rate to stay at this hotel. I don't want any reader of this review to get a totally negative impression from this review, because there are some very positive features that must be noted, such as its location (fantastic), very comfortable beds, nicely decorated and furnished hotel, friendly and hip staff, which would be attractive to younger travelers. On the negative side, the bathroom was average (for a four star hotel), the usual expensive mini bar with an additional 20% service charge added for "our convenience"; expensive room service and restaurant (there are plenty of good restaurants and diners in close proximity); several noticeable stains on the carpet; dim lighting (which might be considered a plus by some). For the price we paid, the hotel was great value, but if you are paying the rack rate, look at other four star hotels in Chicago to compare, as hotels in Chicago are not that expensive (compared to say New York).

Reviews.Title: “Hubby and I spend Valentine's Day in our 2nd fave city..”
Reviews.Author: LoriS10
Reviews.Content: We finally stayed in a Hard Rock Hotel. And truthfully it was nothing special. Love the vibe at the Hard Rock Cafes, but the hotel was just boring, boring, boring. Nothing special.. I was expecting it to be 'special' but it was just an overpriced hotel. The hotel bar was asleep, all the time and the view we got wasn't that great. Next time, we'll avoid the HR price tag and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “clean comfortable and central”
Reviews.Author: chiahong1
Reviews.Content: very close to the millenium park, state street shops like macy's, sears,old navy etc...we use the blue line metro from o'hare airport, got off at clark and walked 5 blocks to hotel. we bought a 7 day cta pass at the airport and used it for going everywhere. easy to use public transport. at o'hare the ticket machine is situated behind the usual transit ticket machines. buses goes up and down the magnificent mile pass the hotel. hotel has 2 free internet station wth printer which we used to print boarding pass. helpful staff and conceige. free coffee in the lobby in the mornings. dont touch the fridge items in it, they are weight sensitive and just moving an item triggers a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great city shame about the spiders!”
Reviews.Author: buckshee72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first time this September, What a nice hotel, everyone very friendly rooms really nice and comfortable beds. I was just a little shocked to see so many spiders out side my window on the 20th floor???? A must stay, if in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: ar1960
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience with the Hardrock on my birthday. The staff was very courteous and extremely friendly. The Gibson guitar loaner proram (at no cost) was very cool. On Friday I got to check out 2 nice acoustics and on Saturday an electric (ES-335) with a line 6 pocket POD with headphones. Lots of great sites within a few blocks too.

Reviews.Title: “Room Service @ Midnight and it was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ChiRedFlyer
Reviews.Content: Hotels think it's cute to post they offer 24 hr room service only to find out it's a delivery pizza they offer, if that. The Hard Rock won my heart by send us up ridicoulouly large portions of fresh pasta and steak @ 12am. Also, some chick came by w/ free water and chocolates. Good size room, clean modern decor. We slept in, no real problem w/ noice despite being sold out. Lounge is a bit to jetsetty for my taste but it was fine for a night or two. Great location to wander the Mag Mile or take a river tour not to far away. I mean it's a Hard Rock property so it's over the top trying to be cool, but ya know...they didn't do too bad. Please note, we got an insane price of $99 a night. I don't know if I'd want pay more than that unless you really needed to be in that location or t was a special occasion..

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: ashmarie589
Reviews.Content: I love Chicago, this hotel is great. The location is wonderful right off Michigan Ave, great places to shop and eat. Millennium Park is 3 blocks away. Are room was very nice and clean. Great view from our room of Michigan Ave, and the Chicago River, John Hancock, And the Sears Tower. The only problem we encountered was a problem next door our neighbors were throwing some sort of hotel room party very loud and obnoxious, but the hotel security took care of it within a couple mins. And being right by the elevator was okay it just got annoying hearing dinging noises every minute other than that it was a great stay. Will be back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Music lovers hotel on N. Michigan Ave.”
Reviews.Author: mimicry
Reviews.Content: I booked through the hotel website at the Chicago Jazz Festival package rate. Service was pleasant. Clean room and comfortable bed. Nice big HDTV too. My room had no exciting city view but was quiet. I agree with other reviews about the room being dimly lit. I like it that way but it's not for everyone. The hotel is within easy walking distance to L trains, shopping, Millenium Park, Grant Park, sightseeing boats and buses. Great rock n' roll memorabilia on each floor as you would expect from a Hard Rock property. The uniquely cool aspect of this hotel is the Check In Rock Out program. Hard Rock Chicago has a great selection of high-end Gibson electric and acoustic guitars available to loan for free. Just sign the agreement and the bellman brings a guitar to your room. My only small complaint is that free wi-fi is available only in the lobby. The cost in-room is $10 each day.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: hdermenchyan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hard Rock before, but I had booked one night for my wife and I as a transition from our honeymoon to our new residence in Chicago. We were had a warm greeting, were given very nice accommodations, and within 10 minutes of settling in, a bottle of wine with strawberries and chocolate were presented to us. They really go above and beyond to make you feel welcome every time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTogether97
Reviews.Content: The interior was fun, modern and we slept on one of the most comfortable hotel beds ever. The location was perfect and breakfast at the China Grill was quite good. I would stay there again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: jengirl000
Reviews.Content: my fiance and I stayed at the hard rock for a long weekend in Chicago. We got a very good deal online ($140 per night... this was a lot lower than the surrounding hotels) and so I was a little nervous that it was not going to be a good stay. The staff throughout the weekend were very helpful and kind. The location of the hotel is perfect for doing anything downtown. We had only a couple block walk to the subway and millenium park is also very close. The river is only 1 block away too. The rooms are very modern and comfortable.The only down side I would say is that the hotel room seemed to be somewhat dark. During the day it was not an issue with the window light but at night it was definitely not lit well if I was trying to read, etc. Lastly, the bar is extremely over priced. If you're looking to have a few cocktails walk a block or 2 and you'll find a better mixed drink for less money! I would definitely stay at the hard rock again,

Reviews.Title: “Rock Star status at anytime!!”
Reviews.Author: asantebutterfly
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a mid week birthday getaway, upon making the assumption that a weekeday stay would be recieved as not as important to the hotel staff, I couldnt have been more wrong. We were treated and greeted on a first name basis, we were anticipated from everything from front dest to in room dining. All around theservice and our stay was superb!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very interesting, exciting and so pleasant”
Reviews.Author: connie_chestnut
Reviews.Content: My stay at the â€œHard Rock Hotelâ€� was a delight. I usually try to avoid business travel because I donâ€™t get a good night sleep. This experience with you was superb! My good night sleep helped me to enjoy the whole experience of being in Chicago and attending our conference. The hotel was very interesting, exciting and so pleasant. What wonderful workers you have there. There is a real comfortable ambience about the whole hotel. Thank you, thank you for a memorable experience. I intend to return not just for business but also for pleasure! Sincerely, Connie Chestnut CMSW Alzheimerâ€™s Association of Southeastern Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: vic1965
Reviews.Content: We had a great room, two queen beds on the tenth floor. View was good, could've been better. I was amazed at how quiet it was. Could not hear any neighbors. Bathroom was clean, well appointed, and plenty of hot water. Beds were very comfortable and clean. The building was beautiful. We loved sitting at the base bar and watching people go by on the sidewalk. Concierge was very helpful. We never carried a bag after arriving!! The staff was extremely friendly. I loved the hotel store. Someone working there owns a fuzzy white bycycle that reminded us of ZZ Top!! It was parked outside the hotel. Staff there love their jobs, it is all over their faces!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a staff that really cares and matters!”
Reviews.Author: HEPF
Reviews.Content: Me and my family (wife and 2 teen boys) stayed on the Hard Rock Hotel during July for this year's Taste of Chicago. As mentioned on many reviews, this hotel's location is great! You are close to the Magnificent Mile and close to Millennium and Grant Parks. You can do almost everything within walking distance. The historical building is simply beautiful and the overall decor gives it a special feeling. Rooms are quite standard for this kind of hotel without above average amenities or accessories. In terms of room floor space it tends to be on the smaller side if you are in regular room. Beds are simply GREAT! one of the best ones we have ever had in a hotel. Downturn is the closet, it is minuscule! It cannot even handle one person's stuff, much less four people. We had to keep our stuff in the bags for our 5 days stay, because there were not so many drawers neither. When we checked in, we were given a room that smelled terrible as being a smoking room (it actually wasn't), we immediately went over to reception and the nice lady apologized and gave us an updated room for that night. Because the Taste of Chicago the hotel was at 95% capacity. The next morning they arranged for our stuff to be transferred to our definitive room on the 20th floor that was beautiful and with a great view. This is a great hotel that I would fully recommend, and the next time I'm in Chicago it will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Slick spot, but a few holes...”
Reviews.Author: bgibb
Reviews.Content: Nice tourist hotel, but not great for business. Rooms are clean and slick, but no outlets, and minimal closets. Also, the TVs are new, but the cable didnt work and all I got was HBO and Fox News - no CNBC and MSNBC which I needed for work. The gym is cool, but again, half the cardio machines didn't work and the cable in the gym didn't work. Oh, and the wireless in my room didn't work. I was willing to pay for it as I needed it for business, but no luck. The service here was great in that the staff really seemed to be trying their hardest, but the property thwarted their efforts!

Reviews.Title: “Would look elsewhere for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfan082
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at the Hard Rock Hotel in downtown Chicago after finding out that the hotel hosting my conference (the Fairmont) 2 blocks over was fully booked. This was a 5-day conference; I checked out 2 days early. For any sensitive sleepers out there (say you wouldn't appreciating housekeeping pounding on your neighbor's door at 10:30 PM to ask if he's going to check out yet that night), I would suggest a different hotel. Don't bother to ask the desk clerk for any solutions either. Also - this is ironic and will become more evident as you keep reading - there's an one inch gap under the door. Not only does this make soundproofing IMPOSSIBLE, but it also allows boat loads of light to filter in at night (a wash cloth over the lighted alarm and a tissue box in front of the TV's clock fixed those problems). Thus, I stuffed pillows beneath the door to decrease the light. Back to the light irony: the light filtering beneath the door is probably the most light you'd get in the room. I understand mood lighting, but reading for more than 20 minutes in the room was frankly intolerable. Talk about eye strain. Also, if you're a female, the "lighted" make-up mirror in the bathroom is inadequate. It might make it as a night light for my three year old. On the upside, this hotel is in downtown Chicago, directly on Michigan and Lake. I got parking around the corner on Lake (60 E. Lake) for $31/night. Free Internet access is available in the lobby area only (not in the room). There's a restaurant on-site (Chinese), which I did not try as Houlihan's was right around the corner. That being said, you couldn't get me to stay in this gray and depressing hotel again - even if it was a free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: mrsfeo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel twice now and plan to come back at least once a year. The first time we stayed at the hotel was actually for our honeymoon in September 2008. We had a gorgeous suite with great views on two sides. When we came back for my husband's birthday in February this year, we were just as impressed with the standard room we stayed in. The beds are comfortable; the rooms are inviting and relaxing. On both of our visits the staff was friendly and accomodating, from the guys at the door to the front desk and the wonderful lady who brought us room service (on both visits! She was great; I think her name is Lila). We love that the hotel is within walking distance (even in February) to just about everything we like to do while we're in town. We also love that we could stay in the hotel and never leave if we chose to! There's a great restaurant and a trendy and fun bar right in the building. All in all, we feel that this hotel is one of the best we've ever stayed in and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “BEST Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: sterlinggirl
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago a minimum of 6-8 times per year and always stay at the Hard Rock Hotel. They have provided quality customer service in a great atmosphere. The rooms are well designed and always extremely clean. They have always gone above and beyond to accommodate any request we have made. The location is fantastic and the staff is amazing. I highly recommend you try out the Hard Rock Hotel the next time you are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: IndyMichael
Reviews.Content: Def will stay there again. Good service and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, drab average rooms”
Reviews.Author: mcdana22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend trip to Chicago over memorial day weekend. We got a great deal on hotwire for less than $130/night and took the Amtrak train into town to avoid paying for parking (since it is almost pointless to have/drive a car in Chicago anyway). Upon check in we were greeted with friendly staff. The female at the concierge desk was especially helpful. The decor of the hotel was typical "hard rock" style (leather, animal print, guitars, ect). There is an area in which you can use their computers but there are only 2 (1 PC and 1 mac) and sometimes a wait to use them. The rooms are dark. They have gray walls, gray linens, gray/black furniture and low lit lamps. The bathroom is also very dark with florescent lighting making it difficult for makeup application (important for the ladies on a night out). The beds were comfortable. I recommend the all you can eat breakfast buffet for $9 each around the corner at Houlihan's versus the pricey room service at the hotel (we tried both and the food was better at the buffet). All in all this was a great central location. Close to Michigan ave shopping and close to the loop district for parks and theater.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...didn't care for it.”
Reviews.Author: MR_PHL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week-long business trip in Chicago. The hotel was selected for me and the price was a bit over $200 per night. Location: Right on Michigan Ave. Great if you are in town for sightseeing or business. If you want to get around town on the 'L' it's a short walk up Wabash to the station. There are some restaurants in the area. We ate at the Emerald Loop and found it to be good. Check-in: Relatively fast. My room selection was correct. No problems. Room: 19th floor. Generally well decorated and laid out. The room has a flat screen TV. Unfortunately the TV stopped working on Thursday of my stay. Rather disappointing. But since I was checking out the next day, it wasn't worth it to call a technician. Bathroom was clean, although the shower head didn't hold its position very well. It would slip and forced me to stand almost against the wall to get water. There is in-room internet, but it costs $10 or so a day to use it. I really hate hotels that still charge for internet. It's like having an extra tax slapped on you. Hotel: The property is in the old Carbide & Carbon Building. Its an older building and when you first walk in, the Art Deco Interior screams at you. The lobby itself is modern. Bar on the first floor. Once inside the renovated areas, you get all of the rock star kitsch hanging about. There is an internet station with two computers in the lobby to print boarding passes and check email. The computers are always being used, probably because of the in-room charge. There is a Chinese restaurant that serves breakfast in the morning. I think it was about $18 for the breakfast buffet. OK, not fantastic. Small selection of hot food with a bread/pastry stand. Its not laid out well for a buffet and can be tough to get around if there are more than a few people milling about. Service: OK. I typically don't want maid service until I need things tidied up. But there wasn't a "Do Not Disturb" sign around. So I called the front desk and told them that I wouldn't need housekeeping. When I got back, I found that housekeeping had been in the room. So I had to call down for a "Do Not Disturb" sign. On one of the days, my 7:30 wake up call was really late. Fortunately the alarm on my IPhone woke me up. But that's not something that I consider to be acceptable. Overall: I just wasn't impressed. My company paid good money and I think I could have done better elsewhere. The TV breaking down was just the last thing in a line of events that gave me pause. I strongly recommended to other colleagues headed out to Chicago that they should choose another property. If the hotel is priced far below the competition, you might consider it. But I think there will be strong alternatives for what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Feel the Chicago blues inside of the windy city”
Reviews.Author: ManuGraillansky
Reviews.Content: Really pleasant place, ideally located on Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin on the River!”
Reviews.Author: jrrudd7
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was excellent! Good location near the River on Michigan Ave, the staff was great, the room was clean, and overall was a great hotel at reasonable prices. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive, but a complete racket”
Reviews.Author: DetroitGirl_10
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous building inside and out. Front desks staff was edgy. They fit the scene, but they didn't seem particularly impressed that you were staying at their hotel (read, not very friendly or gracious). It was a Monday morning and I inquired about early check-in (by 2 hours), and was told I'd have to pay an additional $49. I practically lived at Radisson for business, and could check in whenever I wanted. You need an obscure code for their internet even when plugged into the hardline in your room, and they charge $9.95 for 24 hours of "VIP service." I have no idea what is VIP about being able to access the Internet in a hotel room in the year 2010... I had no problem getting online at the Country Inn I stayed at in Kentucky a few weekends ago... believe me, there was nothing VIP about that. Furthermore, your connection abruptly times out at 24 hours... even if you are staying for multiple days like I was. Where they saved on their archaic internet connection sign in process, they splurged on a high tech Pink Panther style mini bar, which is kept in a drawer. In fact at first glance it is so understated, you have no idea it is a mini bar and not just a small array of complimentary snacks (no pricing or note that you will be charged). This is where it gets really fun.... if you just pick an item up to look at the caloric content, you get charged for it, because they have a high-tech weight-sensor under each item... as though it is the Golden Jubilee. Apparently the Hard Rock loses millions of dollars a year in snickers. I don't know. The place IS cool. If I could fit the ultra luxe wool curtains in my bag I would (don't worry Hard Rock, they're still right where you hung them). The bath items were very nice, too... although like the previous reviewer wrote, the lights are dim! I don't mind that night-club lighting, but it would have been nice to have the option to turn up the light, or at least be provided with a vanity light so I could see my face up close, which is important for men & women alike. Also like the last reviewer wrote, the walls are paper thin. Luckily I was tucked away down a hall and only heard a few early morning door slams. At night I heard someone rustling through their purse to find their room key. I can't imagine coming to this place to for a romantic getaway... if you catch my drift. What it's probably good for? Saying you've stayed here. But really... it's the poor attitude and nickel-and-diming you that sucks about this place. I cannot recommend it even though the building is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Beauty08
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel while in Chicago for the Taste and it was awesome! The location was centraly located to all downtown attractions and shopping. We really enjoyed the hotel and our stay and would definitely stay there again. Also the staff was VERY friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel, Don't Stay Anywhere Else!!!”
Reviews.Author: BlondeeIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days, over the 4th of July weekend with our 7 and 13 year old boys. The rooms were fabulous, spacious and the views were second to none. The staff is tremendously accomodating, making sure your every need is taken care of - sometimes even before you ask. The central location is priceless, located blocks from the 'El' train, water taxi (which services Sears Tower, Navy Pier & other stops) and both Millenium & Grant parks. I've stayed in multiple downtown hotels, including the frequently recommended Renaissance Hotel, and would never stay anywhere but the Hard Rock Hotel Chicago from this point forward. Don't pass this phenomenal opportunity up if you travel to Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely recommend staying at Hard Rock Hotel Chicago A++++”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_buckeye
Reviews.Content: I was completely satisfied with my stay at the Hard Rock Chicago Hotel from the moment I pulled up to valet. The staff were all super friendly, the rooms and hotel were very clean, and they have the most comfortable beds you can sleep on with pillow top mattresses and duvet covers. We tried out the Check In, Rock Out program and had an absolute blast playing around with our Gibson SG Carved Top guitar...and all for FREE!! Definitely two thumbs up and I look forward to staying here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: sgjones
Reviews.Content: I have been to Chicago a couple of times and the Hard Rock is the best stay I have ever had! Great location,friendly staff, and just a great feel to the place! I will stay here every time i"m in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: rak58
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hard Rock for a long weekend because it looked cool, had a fantastic location, and at $134/night through Priceline, it was a steal.. We were not disappointed. This hotel is great for any type of travel. The general vibe of the hotel is hip and contemporary. Rock music and videos throughout the main lobby created an upbeat atmosphere. Check in was a breeze. We were travelling with teenaged kids so requested (and were given) rooms adjacent to each other at check in. Each floor is decked out in rock and roll memorabilia. We were fourtunate to be on Prince's floor (rooms 1606 and 1607). The rooms are large and comfortable. The bathrooms were modern, spacious and clean. Again, the feeling is contemporary. These rooms had a great view of the river and Chicago Tribune building between the adjacent properties. Our KISS themed bath was a favorite of our kids (theirs was STING). The complementary Hard Rock shower products were awesome. Unfortunately, they are not for sale. The hotel is directly accross from Millenium Park and an easy walk to world class restaurants and shopping. From this location we were able to walk to the aquarium, field museum, navy pier, and many other attractions. The Chicago Architecture Foundation river cruise is a block away and not to be missed. Sounded kind of lame, but it is really cool and you see and learn lots of fun stuff about the city. We have stayed at other hotels in Chicago while visiting our son who lives there. We will always stay at the Hard Rock from now on. A great value and a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “It rocks”
Reviews.Author: Cococay76
Reviews.Content: Room The size of the room was perfect, with two chairs and a small table und you could still walk around the bed. There is also a small coffee machine so I could have my first cup of coffee in the morning in bed! Bathroom was also sufficend and I'm still smelling like see grass. So the room was good for two people, but if you take a closer look you can see, that the furniture is a couple of years old, but everything is clean! Service If you want to check in before 3 pm, there is an early check in fee. (25$) But other that this new information, the service was perfect. There is also a concierge who makes reservations for you or has good restaurant tipps. Location The hotel location is perfect for a sight-seeing trip to Chicago. Its on Michigan Avenue close to the river and Millenium Park. But being so close to everything means also, that even when your room is in the 10th floor, you can still hear the noise of a big city.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel, the location was perfect, so close to everything....”
Reviews.Author: sfcafox
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about booking a Hard Rock Hotel but after booking I have to say, it was an amazing stay. The views from every room were incredible, up / down MIchigan Avenue, overlooking Millennium Park in the distance and even a small view of the Lake Michigan waterfront. Quick five minute walk and you're in the heart of the Magnificent Mile shopping area and less than five minutes to Millenium Park and Grant Park / Art Institute, etc. I'd stay here again in a heart beat. The service of this property was amazing, the hotel staff bent over backwards for everyone in our group. We will come back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: V01ga
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decent. Nothing to rave about except for location which is perfect for sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: nalcala
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel a 4 because of two reasons, price and location. You are in the heart of everything if you stay here. Almost everything is within walking distance. We even got to see the blackhawk parade from our room, which was a once in a lifetime experience. I went through a third party website and found cheaper rates. If you go through hard rock and you have AAA, make sure you say it up front. You get free breakfast with a AAA membership. Glitches of the hotel - Out of 4 days we had to flag down our own cabs, except one time. We arrived at 9pm to the hotel and were told they overbooked the rooms and we had to get a smoking room when we requested a non-smoking. We were comped 2 free drinks at the bar for that, which was nice. We switched to a non-smoking room in the morning. The walls are thin and you can hear everyone walking by, opening/closing doors in the hallway and every ambulance that passes by throughout the night. (We were on the 17th floor). There is only one restaurant and a bar in the hotel. Normally this isn't a problem but the restaurant doesn't serve breakfast and it is only Asian fusion, so after awhile it would get boring. The appetizers at the bar are also on the menu at the restaurant so you are eating the same food. We had breakfast for room service once and it was ok. I suggest walking up the magnificant mile and eating breakfast at eggsperience on ontario. Decently priced, open 24 hours and extensive menu. No swimming pool. They do have free wifi but you have to call every 24 hours to get the new passcode. No problem really but if you are in the middle of doing work stuff online it will time out and you have to start over. If we visit Chicago again, we would definately stay at the hard rock. Places of interest - Carmines for dinner. Planetarium/shedd aquarium to get great city view pictures. Take a south Chicago tour, lots of unknown history and you can see where president Obama lives. Happy Travels :)

Reviews.Title: “great location - perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: MrBigGuyNJ
Reviews.Content: extremely helpful staff, location good for museums, downtown shopping, and miracle mile. Historic building

Reviews.Title: “Best buy for a trip i have made so far”
Reviews.Author: shucks60766
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for a getaway week and we choose the Hard Rock Hotel. Great choice they were friendly as soon as we stepped off the van. The rooms were very clean and very updated i had read reviews where people had problems with lighting in their rooms but our room was fine. The staff was very nice and were very willing to help, they told us good places to eat, and stuff to see and how to get there. The Hard Rock is in a great location right downtown everything is in walking distance but you if you don't like to walk there is always a taxi. Just a tip you don't to get airport transportation from the Hotel to the airport best way we found was to take the train to the airport it is right around the corner from the Hotel and is very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “If in downtown Chicago, IL”
Reviews.Author: lauletta1
Reviews.Content: Room was well appointed, clen and comfortable. For the money, i feel the best buy in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: zenMichigan
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a college graduation. We were very disappointed with the size of the room. No extra space or chair, cramped all the way around. We were on the 16th floor, the view was a partial view of Mich. Ave. nothing great. No storage, drawers or places to set things, and the refrigerator is a nightmare. A sneeky trick to try and charge for things you didn't consume. I would not recommend this hotel. I will say that housekeeping did a terrific job, and the location is okay, but prefer to stay more north on Michigan Ave, and the beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great time, great service.”
Reviews.Author: nt828282
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visit Chicago often, and this was the first time to stay at he Hard rock. Service was great will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: mickeymouz
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel located in the heart of Chicago. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and courteous. My room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Just your average typical room. Friends of mine were assigned suites. I have to say they were very nice. Located on the upper floors of the hotel with great views of downtown Chicago. Huge living area. Big bath room with shower and tub. Large bedroom with huge windows. Way above average. The rooms are supplied with snacks and a bar with a variety of drinks to choose from...for a hefty price. If you even pick up a snack from the "snack drawer" or pick up a drink from the bar, the electronic eye will sense that it has been removed and a charge for the item will appear on your hotel bill. If you need snacks and drinks, there is a Walgreen's located just a across the street from the lobby entrance. This was a convenience and saved me some money. The Base bar was a nice place to relax and hang out with friends for a few drinks in the evening. The bar waitress was very nice and checked on us frequently within the first hour or so we were there. After about an hour, our waitress disappeared. Drinks are a little pricey which is to be expected in a nicer hotel. A bottle of Bud Light is $5.50. The Concierge service was great. The staff was very friendly and very helpful in suggesting restaurants and things to do around the hotel. The location of the hotel was great. Located in the heart of Chicago on Michigan Avenue. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. Chicago River tours only a couple blocks away along with the upscale shops on the Magnificent Mile. Only drawback to walking around downtown were the panhandlers.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to come back here on leisure travel...”
Reviews.Author: Verneaux
Reviews.Content: Got a HUGE room on the NE corner of the 21st Floor was huge. The all-gray room decor was a bit bland but well-done overall. Everything functioned properly in the room, and the bathroom was spotless and very nicely done. Bed was very comfy and the room featured a large LCD TV with a speaker booster. Clock radio had an iPod dock too. The Keurig coffee machine worked fine, but be sure to call down for extra "pods" if you intend to consume more than two cups of coffee. Staff was very friendly and the business center was up and running when I needed it. Aveda amenities in the room were terrific. Hard to beat this hotel's great location--two blocks south of the Michigan Ave bridge over the river, and about 1.5 blocks away from the CTA train from/to Midway Airport. My only complaints? Stairs were hard to find, so had to wait for and take elevators to/from business center. The carpet in my room looked worn and a bit dirty, and had a couple burn marks in it. Be careful not to pick up anything out of the minibar unless you intend to consume it--sensors will bill your room automatically. However, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kingfarm
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The people that work there are all so friendly and nice, it was almost a shock to us (coming from D.C.). the hotel room furniture was very modern, which we like. Big flat panel T.V. and we had a great view from the 35th floor. We also enjoyed seeing the rock memorabilia and we borrowed several $3,500 guitars from the desk to play around with. Oh, and great t-shirts and pins in the shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at any Hard Rock Hotel. To begin, before we got there we had to juggle our reservation a little, because I was getting there early and made a separate reservation from my boyfriend. Aaron (the concierge in charge of bands - we were there for my boyfriends' band) was amazing. He took care of everything with no problems and even gave me his cell phone number just in case there was a problem There were no problems. Everyone at the front desk, bell hops, people working in the bar were soooo nice. Very helpful. The room was great, we had an amazing view from the 23rd floor of the river and Michigan Ave. Can't beat the location, it's central to Millenium park and the museums and Magnificent Mile. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you book at the right time...”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerChick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HR Chicago during the work week and had a great rate for a downtown Chicago hotel. Check in was a bit confusing as they expected last names to match to ensure we were married, which I found a bit dated and old school. Hoping that at some point in the future that they get on board with how life works in the real world. Overall it was nice experience. At times I felt the hotel was trying too hard to be cool, but better that than trying too hard to be good and failing. We were put in one of those rooms that I like to refer to as "trip over the furniture" style, but it was fine for two people. We could have paid extra for a larger room, but didn't, so it's not the fault of the hotel. Our room had a king bed and a surprising comfy chair and ottoman. The work desk was large, especially after removing all the stuff they had covered it with. The worst issue about this room is lack of storage. There's an armoire for hanging clothes, plus two shelves and only two small drawers. The rest of the storage is taken up with a minibar and snack drawer that auto-charges, so you can't make use of them for storage. This was painful for two adults staying for a week, as we had to resort to stashing our belongs along the wall behind the chair. The Base bar was a great place for meeting up with colleagues, but at $13 a drink, beyond what most managers would approve on expense accounts. Thankfully, I approve all expenses, so the chili/cilantro/tequila martini I had was fully funded. It took 5 phone calls to get a code to get the wifi working. Everyone was helpful, but it was due to the fact that they have one-use codes that they give out to everyone. So first one to use a code wins. I would definitely stay there again if I could get a similar rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if your timing is right”
Reviews.Author: lcastanon
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend at the Hard Rock with family. We managed to get pretty reasonable pricing on a pair of Platinium Double Queen rooms at 150 per night. For the area and the size of the room it just couldnt be beat. We were a block away from the bean and the nicer parts of Chicago. The beds were quite comfortable, the bathroom was huge, and the view wasnt spectacular but looking down on busy Michigan Ave wasnt too bad. We ordered room service one day, it was kind of expensive as most room service tends to be. With a jug of coffee, a one person breakfast crept up to 50.00. Check-in was pretty effortless, and prompt. One of our rooms was on the lower floors (4) with the China Grill private party area nearby. This would normally be a bad idea as you'd get alot of the ambient noise, but the Hard Rock did its homework and has an extra set of glass doors on that floor before entering the rooms area so the noise was non-existent even with a function going on. Michigan Ave is a fairly busy road, so if ambient noise from outside bothers you, I'd say pick a different hotel. We didnt mind it because we liked the energy of busy Chicago below, but if youre a light sleeper it might be an issue. On checkout, we had a slight issue with a can of redbull that we took out of the minifridge to make room for some milk we had left over from the convenience store. They had originally charged us for the redbull (8 dollars). But they quickly removed it when i brought it up that we didnt drink it. The people behind me had a similar complaint so I assume its pretty common. It might be one of those pressure sensitive minibars that senses when somethings been moved. Definately skip the minibar, its way expensive and theres limitless convenience stores and establishments all around there. The sale rate we got was kind of hidden online. If you goto their site the default rate is labeled as The best rate, but there are specials underneath that drop down that are actually better rates. So the term 'best rate' is kind of decieving. All in all, it was a pleasureable experience and I was pleased with the value of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for fun and work”
Reviews.Author: marianne2025
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel ~ Chicago ~ for a week. ART Chicago was the mission. We had a blast at the hotel. The front desk staff is A+ in getting you checked in and out pronto. The bartenders in the hotel bar are really great in answering questions on where to go for music , food and more fun. We found a little place called Snicker that offers a terrific breakfast and then some! The Grand Lux Cafe for lunch or dinner is just yummy. As an out of towner who would have known about the Kingston Mines, a great two stage blues club, a inexpensive cab ride away for all night good music. The rooms are clean and up to date. The fitness center is very cool easy to get your 30 minute workout done at any hour. The executive room offers easy wifi or just use their computers and printers. EASY. The hotel is so centrally located you can walk almost everywhere.quickly to any point of interest (like the ART INSTITUTE, JOHN HANCOCK BUILDING, NAVY PIER, etc). The hotel restaurant is serves up high quality Asian Fusion style .Breakfast there was amazing as you can have healthy juices, and an array of extraordinary eggs, breads, etc. Dinner is great for a party of 10, no problem. Will be going back just for fun next time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey”
Reviews.Author: chuckc22
Reviews.Content: Was on a business trip to Chicago and stayed here. I was impressed with the decor (very Art Deco). Took longer than normal to check-in and the desk person was not very friendly. I expected a better view from my room. I had a partial view of Michigan Ave. I had dinner at their restaurant. The sushi was not bad. On a positive note, the location was excellent. There was a gorgeous park across the street which was perfect for an evening stroll. Overall not a bad hotel but I have stayed at better for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Jonahjohn
Reviews.Content: We are 77 year seniors so were somewhat nervous about the "Hard Rock" aspect. The theme was interesting even for us. The entire interior of the old "Carbide and Carbon Building" is redone. The location is outstanding in being 1 block from the river on Michigan. We prepurchased a CTA 24 hour unlimited bus pass and used it 8 times. Service was friendly and helpful and the price was 50% lower than others in the area. The China Grll had just the right mixture of flavors and smaller quantities. The dishes are served on a common plate for sharing, a great idea. I highly recommend the Architectual River Cruise as a way for newcomers to be quickly oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away there are Better Options”
Reviews.Author: GregandJill
Reviews.Content: I'm currently mid-stay at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago. The hotel is OK overall, but the staff has given me the run-around and there are better deals in the immediate area: 1) SMALL rooms: Some of my co-travelers are staying at Inn Of Chicago, which is very close to the Hard Rock Hotel. The hotel is virtually identical to the Hard Rock. The difference? The rooms are twice as big at Inn of Chicago and the rates are lower. My room at the Hard Rock is a small walkway with two double beds. 2) Room not available: Not a huge deal, but I ordered a non-smoking room with a king size bed. Instead, the only non-smoking room they had was two queen beds. So what exactly did I reserve with my reservation? 3) The Hard Rock will attempt to charge you $10-$15 for a day of internet service. When I called to ask about this, I was told that "every hotel in the area charges for internet access, and most charge even more." Well, it turns out that the hotel next door charges NOTHING for internet service, as I am using it right now to write this review. If there's one thing I can't stand, it is when a business lies to me. Overall a good hotel for the aspects of cleanliness and location. But if you don't like tiny rooms, being lied to by staff, and forced to play the complain-for-service game (which I refuse to play), stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel but staff not so great”
Reviews.Author: TravelGnu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend with my partner and right off the bat, the staff wasn't very nice. The reservation was in my partner's name and I arrived before him and they would not let me check in. I guess this is a security measure but how many people would try to check in for someone else? The hotel is rather small and the rooms are small but it is in a good central location. It is within walking distance to the water, museums and shopping. We got a pretty good deal so it was worth staying there. I wouldn't recommend this hotel unless you get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: jzombek
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hard Rock Hotel on Hotwire for a brief weekend in Chicago before heading on to a wedding. The location, right on Michigan Avenue and near the major "El" lines was outstanding. Our room, which was on the 4th floor, was large, clean, and well-appointed. The bed was fairly comfortable and the bathroom was spacious and had the kind of amenities you would expect at four-star property. I would have to agree with some of the other reviewers, however, that the rooms are dark. It was fine for us since we just wanted a place to relax and sleep after being out all day, but I could see where it would be a problem for a business traveler trying to prepare for the next day's meeting. The climate control system didn't do as well as it could have in keeping the room cool, but it seemed that the weather had just turned warm and it could take a little while. Valet parking at $46 per night seemed a little expensive to me, but we were in Chicago. The staff is what would make us come back to this hotel. Our request for foam pillows was met within a matter of minutes. The bartender and waitress at the Base Bar were friendly, and effieient and made sure that we enjoyed ourselves (the cocktails were reasonably priced for a trendy spot, too). The concierge staff were the most helpful I've encountered, especially Paula who worked on Friday and Saturday nights. She had tremendous knowledge of the area and suggested two spots for dinner that were exactly what we were looking for each night. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back, especially if we were able to get the Hotwire rate again.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Rocks”
Reviews.Author: MuzH
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hard Rock Hotel for a New Year trip to the wonderful Windy City. What a great hotel its is. The location is downtown, only a short walk from Millennium Square and "Cloud Gate" (shiny steel sculpture in the shape of a bean). Great location. The building itself is the old Carbon and Carbide building, a stunning Art Deco skyscraper. Being a little disorganized for the New Year celebrations we decided to just go down to the hotel bar. Arrived at 9pm and it was pretty quiet. We got a seat at the bar. By 10pm it was jumping and we saw the New Year in Chicago style with some beers and whiskys. What a great trip to Chicago and we were both so pleased we booked the Hard Rock Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld79
Reviews.Content: Been to Chicago many times and love Michigan Ave. Booked this hotel with HotWire which gave it a 4 star rating. Negatives: Dark room, small bathroom, thin walls, dirty room (glass rings on tables), old sheets, checkin counter not overly friendly, bathroom products not fully stocked, thermostat not accurate, no resturant (a bar is not a resturant). Positives: good location- crossed the street and went to the Hyatt Regency for breakfast and dinner. Next time I will stay at the Hyatt Regency or the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “A "Rockin' Good Time :)”
Reviews.Author: happymommyof2grls
Reviews.Content: Everything was Excellent. Very friendly staff. Fabulous location and view. Perfect for our children 4 and 6 too. They loved the rooms and hotel feel was appropriate for little ones. We were able to utilize the free rental of custom guitars available. We also were able to cuddle up into a king size bed and watch New Release kids movies both times we went. In early march and in late march. Able to easily walk to everything. Our kids even could walk to Navy Pier and Water Tower Place. Had sooooo much fun. Can not say enough how welcoming, friendly and wonderful all staff was. We will return. Live in suburbs but always in the city for family fun. Close to Millenium Park in the summer so perfect for that as well. Stay here. It is Great. Also, products in rooms are all great- wonderful smelling. If in Chicago, it is a new top choice for our family.

Reviews.Title: “The Hard Rock ROCKS, and the staff will try to accomadate in any way possible.”
Reviews.Author: BigHern
Reviews.Content: I had forgot some important reservation info, but the people at the front desk were more than helpful. I also changed my mind on the type of room I wanted in comparison to my reservation, so while the staff was making sure my room was ready i was given a pass for free drinks. The staff is very helpful, very laid back, and very nice, all around genuine good people.

Reviews.Title: “Best location on the mag mile!”
Reviews.Author: HungryDave
Reviews.Content: I'm just wrapping up a trip to downtown Chicago, and leaving the Hard Rock Hotel today. I checked in swiftly at the front desk yesterday, where my room was ready with no problems at all. The gal at the front desk informed me of the free internet, the gym, and a code on the back of my key card envelope where I could download for free from Itunes, one of three custom playlists they had made. Nice touch! My room was fairly high up, and overlooking both Michigan Ave, and a small bit of lake Michigan. I would suggest anyone staying here ask for a corner room on a high floor. Lots of windows in the room (and the bathroom), so be sure to close the curtains unless you want the world to see what God gave you. ;-) The room was filled with some pretty mod furniture, a nice flat tv with a decent surround sound system attached, a huge desk, a fake alligator skinned chair/ottoman, and a few more normal bedroom items. The bathroom was stocked with Aveda products, and a decent size. Location was excellent of this hotel! Right on Michigan Avenue, when you walk out the door, you have the river on your left, and Millenium Park on your right. Just perfect. And very close to the best coffee in Chicago, Intelligentsia. Don't miss it! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago on business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit from '06, 4 Years Later Still Excellent”
Reviews.Author: World_Hiker_Dallas
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent weekend stay at the Hard Rock -- my last Trip Advisor review was in 2006. I see every reason to continue to recommend this property! We really like the quiet rooms due to solid walls, great location and a staff that treats you like its a small, boutique hotel. It's not fancy. But the Hard Rock is no Red Roof either. All the basics are taken care of with nice bed linens, towels and amenities. They even make personal wake-up calls -- I have not gotten that in years -- what a nice throw-back. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WestchesterMommy5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights at the Hard Rock in Platinum King rooms at $135. Great price! We were with five young kids who loved the rock memorabilia (one asked "who's Madonna?". China Grill is typical hotel breakfast buffet, but service was 5 star. Wait staff remembered our kids' drink orders and had set a table for us -- complete with highchair -- without knowing we'd return. The hotel rooms are as has been reported here -- spacious, clean, but terribly outdated and dark. If you remember all the charcoal grey carpet and strange lighting of 1988, you will find it here. But our corner King room had an ENORMOUS bathroom with huge shower (good for multiple kids) and plenty of space for kids to do a little running and bed-hopping (sorry, neighbors). The rooms are perfect for sleeping, getting clean, and leaving. If you're hoping to relax in your hotel room in Chicago, you won't like these rooms. Dark dark dark. Perfect for puttng kids to sleep. Wireless internet was rotten. No connection in one of our rooms and then, in the room next door, a sloooooow connection which kept dropping. But the Hard Rock location is fantastic. My husband was stunned I'd gotten such a good deal on a location this good. If you're with kids, they'll think the hotel is very cool and you won't go broke. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a rock star...oops...I am a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: kissleecoco
Reviews.Content: Room was awesome! Super clean, comfy bed - AVEDA products in the bath!!!! (HUGE plus!!!) iPod hook-up in room - BONUS! Great location - easy to get a cab if needed! (Overnight parking was freakin crazy $$$ tho!) Base was fun & low-key...shots cost about as much as parking...our server, Danny, was crazy amazing! (CraMazing?) Overall, we had a great time & would stay there again & again! (Best unused part of our stay: Availability of an electric guitar & amp? in our room for a $3000 deposit!!! If we weren't a completely messed-up wedding after-math, we woulda done it!)

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, but no WOW factor.”
Reviews.Author: TSUAGD
Reviews.Content: I met my husband at the HRH after I had spent three nights in another local hotel for business. We had gotten a discounted rate of $99 per night, and I was excited to have what appeared to be a great rate at a luxury hotel. Having said that, I had no illusions that we would get the best room. I mean, it's not uncommon for hotels to put the guests who paid more in the better rooms. But I WOULD expect the amenities in the rooms to be as stated. Overall, there was a lack of attention to detail. The bathroom was not fully stocked with enough towels, there was no hair dryer, the in room safe batteries were dead, and there was no guest directory for information on the hotel. These things we discovered over the duration of our stay, and it just kept feeling like one more thing after another. I will say that when I was able to very quickly resolve the issues, but really, in this type of hotel those things shouldn't happen. It totally takes away from the experience. The pros: Excellent location, staff friendly and welcoming, very clean and well kept. You can open the windows for fresh air. Cons: As I mentioned above, lack of attention to detail. If I had paid a rack rate for this room I would have been really upset. $9.99 per day charge for wireless internet. Really? At a "luxury" hotel in 2010? We were not offered the in room guitar or the itunes downloads that were mentioned in the guest directory (once I found it!) even though this was something that was supposed to be for all rooms (not just suites or larger rooms) Overall, we had an ok stay. But honestly my customer experience felt the same (if not better) at the Holiday Inn Express I had stayed in for the three previous days. I just feel that there are better hotels for the money if you are looking for a "luxury" experience.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: khotlen
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here for my sweeties 40th birthday since we both had not been here before. All I can say is WOW! What great customer service and the hotel itself is amazing. We had a king platinum with two great window views. The views were amazing of Michigan Ave. and we were so close to great restaurants and bars within walking distance. We already both agreed that we were for sure coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, great service, terrible lighting in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: aboomer
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. Location was good, beds & pillows were very comfy, room service was great(food and service), maid service was great. Hotel was very clean. The only real complaint I would have would be the LACK of lighting....very dull. The most light there is is in the bathroom and even that was not very bright. If I was traveling on business and having to work from my room I would not have been happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: matttristan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, located in good spot, clean, comfortable, everyone was very helpful and polite. Had a upgraded King Suite, little light, little small, no door on shower (it is the style) not a fan. I would recommend staying...Nice bar inside with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great location - Minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: tziambra
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at the Hard Rock Hotel in Chicago and I enjoyed it. The room was spacious and I was lucky enough to have a nice view of the river. The bed was really nice, I have some back problems and I was expecting to wake up feeling some pain but it never happened. The flat screen TV was also a nice plus. The bathroom was also large, the pressure of the shower was a bit capricious but I attributed to the early morning rush. The main minor drawback was the lack of light in the room. I had already read about it on tripadvisor but I thought that people were being peaky but honestly, they were right. If I were to be staying there for a weekend, it would have been fine but since I was there on business for a week, it meant that when I went back to the hotel, I would fall asleep. That is how dark it was. In the morning, I had to move the suitcase in the bathroom in order to find my clothes. My friend, to whom I described it to, said that maybe it was only for rockstars that do not not need light! ;-) OK, jokes aside, it was hard to spend time in the room at night, unless I was lying in bed watching TV. The second minor complaint on my part was the maid service was inconsistent. The first day I had taken out a bag with a pillow and the throw from the closet because it was cold and the next day, it was still on the floor and the throw was not folded, I found it a bit weird. The bathroom floor was not always very clean but the service improved over the week so maybe it was a one-time thing, I did not even bother to complain. My check-in and check-out was very easy and hassle-free, I have no more comments on the service, since I did not eat or use room service. Overall, I would say that the hotel is ideal for a weekend trip in the city, the location is amazing, close to shopping and restaurants. I guess it would also work for business travelers, just add some more floor lamps in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Obama Day”
Reviews.Author: MichelleH5
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel was amazing. If you live/love music, this is where you should stay! The rooms are stylish but very comfortable. You can't beat being on Michigan Avenue. You can walk to everything! We were there for the Obama Rally on Nov. 4th and to see a show. I would stay here every night if I could!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lm91682
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just OK. It was a good value, since I got a great rate on Expedia. Had I paid full price, it would not have been worth it. The rooms are VERY small, as is the lobby. I thought this would be a very lively, party hotel. It really wasn't. The lobby was very small and the bar was not has hopping as I had expected. Another note on security - the elevators are a little separated from the front desk. There is an entrance by the front desk and another by the elevators. There is no real security near the door by the elevators and they do not lock it late at night. My friends and I were waiting for an elevator and an old lady ended up getting in the elevator with us, following us to our floor, all the while telling us a sob story about how her car was towed and she needed money to get it and ended up walking away with $40. We had been out for the evening partying, so clearly were not a skeptical as we should have been and she did look normal, but the hotel's security should have not allowed this person to enter the hotel if they were not a guest. Although the hotel was apologetic and did send security to search the floors for her, I feel it may have been avoided, if the door by the elevator was locked at night. Not a bad hotel. The location was great. But the hotel itself was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “great value / location”
Reviews.Author: ishakil
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat. The hotel is rather up-scale / stylish. Very clean. Attentive staff. I found a great rate through Kayak. Downside: internet isn't free.

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: omegaman41658
Reviews.Content: Staff was perfect, room was comfortable, spotless. and the bed as nice as you could want. This Hard Rock has people that make a difference. Location just right for Loop businesspeople or tradeshow folks. Oh, and if you are a guitar lover in any way, you are in for the Gibson guitar menu at thye front desk that comes up with your bags in mint condition and in tune just about, with a bag of accessories. Go and enjoy one of Chicago's gems.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Lawyer_71
Reviews.Content: My secretary chose this hotel for me because of the convenient location. Upon checking in and seeing the three Les Pauls and a Flying V on the wall behind the counter, I knew that this was the hotel for me. The decor is contemporary and fun. The rooms are very comfortable and relaxing. And each floor has its own rock and roll theme and memorabilia. The first time I stayed there, I got out of the elevator at the floor for my room, and the display case in the elevator lobby contained two guitars that I had actually seen played in concert. If you play guitar, the hotel will lend you a Gibson and a headset to play in your room. This is my hotel of choice for all future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: hfla
Reviews.Content: If you want to get drunk and party, this hotel is great. Otherwise, skip it. Maybe if I had been drunk I wouldn't have noticed the stained walls (really needed a new paint job), the broken faucet in the bathroom, the hardware store special shower head in a tub that was too tiny even for me (just over 5 ft), and the not quite what they were going for decor. And never ever get room service. The BBQ sauce was awful, and my hamburger patties looked like they just took them from the packet and placed them on the bun. Rarer than rare. They had room service late, which was fine because they put us in a room with the ice maker right outside the door (not in an alcove, but right outside) so we were up all night anyway. When we checked in they required an additional hold of $100 for the room bar or whatever. Not thrilled, but didn't mind too much - until days later they still had not removed the charge from the card even though we didn't use anything. After much discussion with the accounting department the charge was finally removed. My only complements were, the bed was decently comfortable, the view was nice, it was conveniently located, and the room service and accounting people were nice. I chose to stay here because the reviews seemed ok and I've always loved the building. I won't be repeating that mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time Ever”
Reviews.Author: DiamondgalDianaG4
Reviews.Content: A bunch of us got together and we had a great time in this hotel we asked for limes and they gave us like a punch bowl of them the rooms were so awesome you really have to see it to believe how extradionary this hotel is i love the decorations on every floor and being surrounded by such elegance. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great pick for a Chicago weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: SCM30
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my husband's 30th bday celebration. We had a "hard rock king" corner room on the 10th floor and it was very nice. Having windows on 2 walls was a huge bonus as far as the views and extra light. The room/bathroom was still a bit dark as far as getting ready but no big deal. We received a complimentary bottle of wine for my husband's bday which was really sweet. Oh, and the location is perfect! Tips for a weekend in Chicago based on what we did: consider getting tickets for Blue Man Group (10-15 minute cab ride away) and perhaps check out Shedd Aquarium (5-10 minute cab ride). We also ate dinner at Weber Grill which was great. We had an awesome trip.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday 2010”
Reviews.Author: birthday2010
Reviews.Content: it was my 44th birthday and i wanted my friends to share an awesome time that the y wouldn't forget. I thought i several place. but in the end I told my boyfriend let's have it at Hard Rock on Michigan Avenue. When we got in the room ( Hard Rock King) my boyfriend was floored. He just kept saying you did good baby! you did good! The Base lounge was a great place to hang out with friends, and have cocktails and appetizers. We had a blast. It was very entertaining. The sttaff was very accommodating to my huge birthday cake. everyone loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great location, Good price!!!”
Reviews.Author: juanotero79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in suite 3103 last December. The room was big, clean and very modern. I enjoyed the view from the 4 windows I had in my suite... the view was FANTASTIC! The bed was very confortable and the bathroom was impecable... Nice tub, and shower. I enjoyed having a sitting area, however, it was not as nicely decorated as in the pictures from the hotel website. No flowers or decorative pillos in the sectional sofa.Too simple... but clean and spacious and that is more important for me. I think you expect what you see in the pictures from the hotel's website. But other than that the hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: xseekerx
Reviews.Content: I had a nice time here. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The lobby was nicely decorated. The room was sort of basic compared to some of other Hard Rocks I've stayed at. The room service however was excellent! the food was very good. Location was pretty good, but not right in the mix of the mile which I had sort of hoped for. It is however close enough to Starbucks and I think CVS to have made me happy. The free internet was a plus. I wasnt a bad hotel, I liked it, but I would have preferred to be just a little closer to some of the things I wanted to do more of. I guess theres always a taxi or train, maybe I'm just not used to December Chicago. Brrr...! S*

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jasonsch79
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re planning on staying in Chicago you have to stay at the Hard Rock. From the excellent staff which ran across the street for me to get me Advil for my (Hangover) Headache to the excellent food readily available. It was the best stay I have had in a long time. Not to mention the rooms were unbelievably up to date and posh. I would recommend this to anyone. Price was so competitive.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: alexmcloud
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel was wonderful. Beautiful room and great location. My girlfriend and I watched snow fall from our rooms windows. The room style was the tower suite which is large and very comfortable. We had views of downtown Chicago from the south, east, and northern widows. Everyone working at the hotel was very polite and i highly recommend staying at the hard rock if your planing a visit to Chicago or have not yet stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & service”
Reviews.Author: CHerPig
Reviews.Content: Hard Rock is in the historic Carbide & Carbon building. Beautiful tile lobby with brass trim and brass elevator grating. Location is ideal for Magnificent Mile shopping and is 5-minute walk to State Street's block-long Macy Store (formerly Marshall Fields) . Easy 10-minute walk to Millennium Park and theatre district. Morton's Steak (65 East Wacker) isonly a few steps from Hard Rock's main entrance. Each of our two, king-bed rooms, was good-sized with a safe, minibar, and large flat-screen. Very friendly reception/concierge service with FREE wi-fi throughout all rooms, free printing in business center, and 20 percent restaurant discount with room key. Large Hard Rock bar was always busy. We snagged 95 dollar week-end rate through Hotwire 4-star properties, located in magnificent-mile/streeterville area. WOW! EXPENSIVE PARKING at all Michigan Avenue hotels! We used nearby public parking garage that was "only" $30./day. UGH

Reviews.Title: “Hard Rock Hotel really does ROCK!”
Reviews.Author: Bluesrus
Reviews.Content: Our experience was truly awesome... we were allowed to check-in early by the GREAT front desk staff & our rooms and their amenities were VERY NICE (the decor has that 'extra touch' feel). The staff (maid service, valet service) were very accomodating and polite... Overall, a very professional Hotel! Ps... Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, great service, clean room, very friendly staff!!”
Reviews.Author: trlvr38
Reviews.Content: From the moment I dropped off my car to the valet and walked in the front door with my 12 year old daughter, her friend and my 10 year old niece, the hotel staff went out of their way to make us all feel welcome and at home. Our room wasn't ready, but no problem, they held our bags, plus we were 4 hours earlier than check-in. Food recommendations were perfect from conceirge staff along with places to visit. Being just across the river from the mile was no big deal, especially when you are there to walk anyway! This was the perfect place to stay. I've visited Chicago a dozen of times, and this was the best visit. PS. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was huge!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sancerregirl
Reviews.Content: What a sleek exterior, cool vibe, and yet so laid back and friendly! Our room was sooo cool, with chrome, lots of mirrors, a wonderfully comfortable bed and pillows, and great bathroom facilities, with a really roomy shower - built for 2â˜º. And what a staff! We asked for a room with "a bit of a view" and wound up with a view of Michigan Avenue, the Wrigley Plaza, and the river. And the location! If you were to make downtown Chicago into a dart board, this would be the bullseye. It is absolutely dead-center, right between the Loop and the Mag Mile, just a block from the river. In fact, we were able to watch the Festival of Lights parade from that great window we were given. It's a block from the Cultural Center and the train station, a couple of blocks from the theater district, the Art Institute, Macy's, etc, etc....It's right by the river walk, plenty of breakfast/lunch spots scattered about. The Hard Rock is into music, giving you the option of renting a Gibson (?) guitar to use if you'd like. Unfortunately, music is one of 2 areas they fell short of perfection for us. There was no cd player for our music (though there was an i pod hookup)...and the rooms could use more storage. They are huge, with lots of wall space, but one more chest of drawers would go a long way to solve that problem. Still, that's not enough to give anything but a stellar review for our weekend stay. We definitely got our Rock On!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Chicago Hotel! Cool Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFromCincinnati
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock Hotel Chicago has become my favorite hotel. I've stayed there at least 5 times now and have never had anything other than a wonderful experience. As you might have guessed - it has a super Rock & Roll theme, with some music paraphanelia in the lobby and on each floor's elevator lobby. The rooms all have large photo murals that are themed to different musicians. You can request being on the floor of your favorite band (like KISS, Aerosmith, etc...) The rooms are GREAT. Well appointed. SUPER Comfortable beds and luxurious sheets and wonderous pillows. The large TV has a cool sound system that ramps up the viewing experience. There's a spacious desk in each room with a mini bar. I've always had a room with big windows and a view down Michigan Ave (the hotel sits right on Michigan - a block from the canal). The bathrooms are furnished with absolutely great fixtures sporting a great design... some of the showers have windows in side of them (you can shower AND enjoy the view down Michigan!) or close the waterproof drapes. I've never had anything but a great experience with the staff here... front desk, doorman, etc are all great. There's a lobby bar that still feels intimate and has nice energy. Big screen TV to catch the latest scores, too. Of course, Rock & Roll music pumps thru the place. You can stay at a "plain" hotel anywhere... but this is a GREAT, WELL DESIGNED, FUN and MEMORABLE HOTEL that you'll want to return back to. If I had one concern - it would be the rather crazy charge for parking your car overnight. My daily car parking rate was close to $50 per night, which I'm sorry to say is about the going rate in the loop. Stay here. Be cool.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: mscay
Reviews.Content: The service from check-in to checkout was excellent - timely and efficient. The room was more then I has expected. It was spacious and laid out very well. I particularly enjoyed the living room area as well as the double closets and separate bath and shower. The bed abd pillows were extremely comfortable. I believe it's the first time I stayed in a hotel that provided a toothbrush and toothpaste in the room. The location was perfect for us as we were able to walk to everywhere we needed to go. I particularly enjoyed the excellent food at theChina Grill which is attached to the Hard Rock hotel. The service was very good and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Sidenote1
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Chicago and I'm so glad I stayed at the Hardrock. The location was unbeatable and everything about the hotel itself was fabulous. From the beautiful and comfortable room to the helpful and friendly staff. Overall, one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Added bonus: 2 minute walk to the "L" train (orange line which goes straight to Midway), making getting to and from the airport totally easy. I will definitely stay at the Hardrock next time I visit Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great....worth every penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: fhv_58
Reviews.Content: I stayed in chicago for a 2 night stay at the hard rock hotel. It was one of the best hotel i've ever stayed at. Great restaurant, bar, and shops. The clients working there were amazing. They helped us with everthing we needed. The rooms were nice and clean. Bathrooms were great. The service was amazing. A lady named Lyla working at the front desk was such a gem. She was so nice!! Great location and wonderful view of the city. Everthying you would want is within couple blocks..so if you want to stay someplace in chicago..do not hesitate to stay at the hard rock!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! The Hard Rock was amazing, great people and great location!”
Reviews.Author: hellokittySacTown
Reviews.Content: The Hard Rock was amazing! The staff was incredible and the rooms were great. The location is pretty prime, the Metra was real close and it seemed like everything was in real close walking distance. I definitely recommend staying here if you have a chance, you will regret it if you miss out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ronksenior
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at the Hard Rock Hotel, and frankly we couldn't have asked for a better stay. The Hotel itself is wonderful, the room was great and the bed was as comfortable as any I've slept in. The staff was prompt, knowledgable and extremely friendly. I plan on making it a yearly stop. So should you.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: liamuk2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2009. The hotel building is old and very nice looking from the outside. Inside the hotel feels a little dated â€“ nothing to be concerned about but the television wasnâ€™t an LCD and the walls a little faded. As others have pointed out the rooms are a little dark but I wouldnâ€™t let this put you off. Didnâ€™t try the food in the hotel as there are plenty of nice restaurants nearby. The location of the hotel was perfect for us â€“ within walking distance from a lot of the touristy things to do in Chicago. The view from our room wasnâ€™t great but Iâ€™m sure they have rooms with better views.
